<Author>Gorwell
<Content>Great location I've stayed in two Affinia properties (the Dumont  50), and both are outstanding values. Location is good (more neighborhoody), rooms are large and nicely furnished with multiple seating areas and small kitchens. We were in NYC the weekend of the April Nor'Easter (8 of rain on Sunday!) and it was great to have a kitchen for our bagels (skip the overpriced breakfast in the lounge) and more room to spread out and read the Times while the rain raged outside.Just a couple of quibbles - the elevators can be really slooooww sometimes, and service from the front desk staff can be a little spotty - tried calling them 3 times from the room and no one ever picked up. Overall, we'll certainly stay with Affinia again.

<Author>basianov
<Content>Great place for frequent business trips I travel to Manhattan often for business, and the Affinia 50 has become my home away from home. Not only is it within walking distance of my office in Midtown, it is also close to many tourist sites, great shopping, and good eating.I particularly enjoy the Club Room at the Affinia. It is fun to lounge, read the paper, and unwind after work if my schedule allows. I also enjoy that I may visit the Club Room anytime I am in Manhattan, regardless of whether I am staying at the Affinia or not. The concierge has been very helpful, and the entire staff at the Affinia has always been wonderful.The beds at the Affinia 50 are the most comfortable of any hotel I've stayed in Manhattan. They are a welcome respite after a long day's work.If you choose this hotel, I would recommend requesting a room on a higher floor. The one time I had a room on the 2nd floor, my AC did not work very well. A colleague of mine, who also had a room on the 2nd floor, complained of something similar. When I've stayed in rooms on higher floors, I didn't have any trouble with the temperature.The fitness room is a bit meager and warm on occasion, but otherwise, it is nice to have workout facilities on site.I am a bit tired of the Affinia's room service menu ... but this will happen when staying at one place frequently.Overall, I am the most comfortable with the Affinia 50 out of the 4-5 hotels I've tried in the vicinity of my office. I would recommend it without hesitation.

<Author>CindyC77
<Content>Lots of Room - Loved it! We stayed at the Affinia 50 on April 13 - 15, 2007. We booked the Amercian Girl Package. Originally we reserved a Studio, but were pleasantly surprised when they upgraded us at no extra charge to a Jr. Suite. I have stayed in NYC a lot for business and usually stay at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square, but this time we had two children along and couldn't have been happier with the room and hotel. We had a living area w/pull-out, two large, comfortable beds, a full kitchen (bring utensils if you plan to use) and bathroom. There was plenty of storage and the pillow menu was great. The pillow that plugs into an IPOD was a big hit with my 10 year old.The Club Floor was spacious and bright and the free coffee was good. The location was super. The diner up on 50th and 3rd, Morning Star Cafe had good breakfast at reasonable prices.Only Negatives - the safe in our room didn't work, but we did not call about it. The bathrobe was missing upon check-in, but the front desk brought a new unopened one to us when we called.The temperature control wasn't the best. Tried to run just the fan for outside noise reduction, but it poured out heat no matter how it was set. We were on the 8th floor facing 50th - so we had some street noise. It wasn't excessive though - we live in the mountains with NO noise - so we notice any noise.All and all - loved the place - and will go back !BTW - if you are a baseball fan - try the Yankee Stadium Tour (when there isn't a game) for a reasonable, memorable tour.If you plan to go to Liberty Park - plan ahead - they give out a limited number of passes online and the day of - to get inside the Statue of Liberty. We missed out on this, but walked around the outside and got fabulous pictures.If you have kids -try Ruby Foos (Pan-Asian) on 49th and Broadway - good food, loud, and roomy - has a kid's menu too.  
<Date>Apr 23, 2007

<Author>EssaMiami
<Content>Great neighborhood hotel. I just got back from a shopping trip to NYC. I originally found out about the Affinia 50 hotel from reading reviews on the TripAdvisor site. And I'm super happy that I did because I probably would not have known about this hotel otherwise. The service was great. The entire staff at the hotel was incredibly curteous. Mid-way through our trip, they recognized us by sight making us feel very welcome throughout our stay. The room was very well appointed. The beds were crisp, clean and very comfy. They even let you select from a menu of pillow options. The bathroom felt recently updated. We stayed in a unit that included a kitchen. Although, the kitchen was very dated, it was very convenient having a full sized fridge in the room for our water, soda, other beverages and restaurant leftovers. The cleaning staff was fantastic! The location is excellent. It's one block away from the Waldorf and just a few blocks from Madisson and 5 Avenue shopping! Right around the corner is an excellent bagel shop = Essa Bagel. The only downside is that the doors slam pretty loud. So every morning I woke up to a symphony of slamming doors as folks left their rooms. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.  
<Date>Apr 20, 2007

<Author>EverettEightball
<Content>Great hotel for a family Wow, what a huge room! We booked a small suite for our family of 5, and it was one of the most spacious rooms you can ever hope to find in New York. It was comfortable, very clean, quiet, and new-feeling. I expected the worst when booking a room in Manhattan, but this room was first-class in every way. The concierge service was also excellent. The clincher was that the hotel was easy walking distance to Times Square, the Theatre District, St. Patrick's Cathedral and Rockefeller Center. The room was more expensive than we usually pay, but it was well worth the price. I really have nothing but raves for this hotel!

<Author>TorontoDebbie
<Content>Great Location and Large Rooms .... and a Few Cautions We just returned from a 3 night visit at the Affinia 50. The location is fantastic - within walking distance to Central Park, Rockafeller Centre, Times Square and many other great spots. The one bedroom suite (there were 3 of us) is large - with a nice living room, dining room, kitchen, bathroom and very large living room.A note of caution if you are booking directly through the hotel. You should book on line and print out the confirmation. When we arrived we were advised that there had been a rate change (and increase of about $60 per night). I was asked to show my confirmation print out to prove the rates I was quoted. Having my confirmation number solved the matter -- but we were astounded that they tried to just increase our rate at check in.The lounge on the 2nd floor is really nice. However, the coffee/tea maker was broken and the promised wireless computer access was for a sign up charge only. Most hotels include wireless for their guests these days, so we found the claims to wireless access a little misleading.Overall, though we had a good stay and enjoyed the Affinia 50.  
<Date>Apr 16, 2007

<Author>BrynMawrBK
<Content>A Great Place to Stay I took my three children for a long weekend in New York in late March 2007 and had a very pleasant experience at the Affinia 50. The location is very convenient, right on the corner of Third and 50th, just about a block from the Waldorf. For about $450 a night we had a one-bedroom apartment with a full kitchen, dining area, comfortable living room and large bedroom with two queens. It's ideal for a family, and while not elegant, the modern furnishings were attractive. The doorman (wearing a snappy black leather fedora) always greeted us cheerfully. The only downsides: no restaurant, services here are minimal, the lobby is tiny and not particularly welcoming, and at times only one of the two elevators was operating. But for this price, all this space in a great location (same block as The Benjamin) is hard to beat.  
<Date>Apr 11, 2007

<Author>BibiW
<Content>Very Good Stay GOOD STUFFLocation -- Midtown, within three blocks of two subway stations. Also great bus services for all directions.Beds -- Me, hubby,and teenage daughters had two queen size beds. (Other hotels have doubles, not queens.) Beds were very comfortable with crisp bedding.Rooms -- Having a small kitchen (full size fridge, microwave etc.) was wonderful. Stored dinner leftovers, bottled wine, desserts, snacks, milk, and take out food from Pax and Azure. Lots of TV stations including one HBO. Lots of storage space, even a cupboard in the bathroom. Not bothered by the noise even though we faced the street on the 6th floor. Yes there are sirens,trash trucks, honking horns etc. But that's what you get in any city. (We live in the country so we're more alert to man-made noises.)Freebies -- Wine and cheese in the 2nd level lounge (between 6-7pm) was a treat, especially before heading to the theatre. Copy of Time Out New York in the Lobby.Staff: Helpful and cheerful apart from the fan incident and poor directions from the 2nd floor concierge.NEEDS WORKAir Conditioning/Fan -- Sounded like a rotating metal vent in a barn. On the first night, we turned off the fan before going to sleep. We didn't turn it on again during the entire 7 nights stay -- even though the temps dropped below zero outside. When I complained to the front desk, he told me how to turn off the fan -- no offer of a technician to fix the problem or moving to another room.Elevators -- Can be slow and crowded, especially at check out times. A number of times, bypassed us even though our call button was pressed.Faucets -- Affina is not alone, I've encountered this in numerous boutique hotels. Many, many unlabeled faucets that turn at strange angles or have to be pushed/pulled with precise force to get water. After 7 days, our 14 year old still could not get the shower to behave without meticulous adjustments by me. Plumbing designers sure sold these hotels a crock!RECOMMENDATIONSUnlimited Ride MetroCard -- $24 per person for unlimited subway and local bus rides until midnight, 7 days from day of first use. We used the card probably four times per day. (Individual rides normally cost $2.) Only drawback is that it can used again only 18 minutes after one use. So if you mess up, you have to buy a ticket or wait 18 minutes. Chinatown shopping -- especially for teenage girls!NY Tenement Museum -- Lower East Side on Orchard Street. Excellent use of two hours and great area for shopping and eating -- Katz's Deli and Guss'es pickles.CityPass -- $53 adult. Allows one time entrance to Circle Line Sightseeing Cruises, Empire State Building Observatory, the Guggenheim Museum, the American Museum of Natural History and the Museum of Modern Art within a nine day period. Makes sense only if you intend to visit at least four of these.Two Hour Circle Line Sightseeing Cruise -- incredible view of skylines and Statue of LibertyEss-a-bagel on 3rd. Just across the street. Amazing fresh bagels.Grand Central Station: Go for the station itself and the fast food court. They have NY food chains and not the usual BK or McDs. Only one subway stop on the 6.Times Square -- only a 20 minute stroll away and sooo full of humanity!1/2 price ticket booth at the Marriott Marquis -- saw the Drowsy Chaperone at 50% off. Seem to be lots available. About a 15 minute wait at 3:00 pm.Most of all go with try anything attitude and don't be scared. NY truly is an amazing place.  
<Date>Apr 9, 2007

<Author>TravellingSquid
<Content>Excellent service, great location I stayed at the Affinia 50 in a 1 bedroom suite (2 queen beds) with my wife and parents on a long weekend trip to New York.We found the location to be excellent for seeing Manhattan - easy to walk to Central Park and the big shops around 5th avenue, and also close to Grand Central station and Rockafella. The subway on Lexington  51st is great to get around most tourist routes.The hotel staff were always friendly and helpful, and we were made to feel that no request was too much trouble. The doormen were well groomed and extremely cheerful, whatever time we saw them!The suite itself was luxuriously large and very clean as well as comfortable, and the hotel provides beds with memory foam matresses and a choice of several types of pillows, which made sleeping there even more enjoyable.We would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in New York!

<Author>RiaW
<Content>Great Hotel I stayed here with my parents after reading reviews on trip advisor, and we were all impressed with the hotel. We arrived before official check in and so my room was not ready, however they were not expecting my parents for few days (it was booked though airmiles 鈥?we did not find out if it was the hotel鈥檚 fault). Luckily they could accommodate them and told us to come back at a certain time. Unfortunately when we came back the rooms were still not ready. In need of a rest we decided to wait in the lounge area, an hour later only one of the rooms was ready (contrary to more promises). When we finally did get the second room it had been upgraded to a suite and my parents were given a bottle of wine and a complementary breakfast. So they were very good about the problems, it is just a shame they had not given us a more accurate time for the rooms being ready we could have had an enjoyable afternoon sightseeing instead. That aside the rooms were of a high standard, very comfortable, clean and even a choice of pillows available. Door staff were extremely helpful and always on hand when needed, they provided loads of maps and event info when they knew we were tourists. Internet access in the lounge area with free printing available - very handy. Only other negative point was the breakfast - they selection was limited, with very little warm food, once items were gone they were not replenished. It was also served in the lounge area so there were not proper tables to eat at. For my parents it was free so not too bad but for what they were charging, definitely not worth the money. There are no shortage of places to grab breakfast in the area so I would recommend giving it a miss if not included in your room rate.Despite the slight problem with check in problem, I would stay here again.  
<Date>Mar 28, 2007

<Author>BFFMaryland
<Content>Great hotel, great price! My friends and I just got back from a girls' weekend in NYC  we stayed at the Affinia 50. The $219/night price (not including the NY taxes  fees) was WELL worth it. As soon as we got there, we entered the hotel and the aroma was incredible! I immediately felt as if we were in the middle of the Carribbean at a spa! Believe it or not, the aroma made me feel relaxed and happy every time I entered the lobby (little touches that made a difference). Upon check in we were offered a room up grade. Instead of 2 rooms with 2 double beds, we were offered 2 suites, each with a kitchenette, king bed  pull out couch. We turned the offer down due to there being 4 of us (and no one wanting to sleep on the pull out), not to mention that we didn't plan on being in the room except for sleeping anyway. The thought of them upgrading us did not go unappreciated though (the decision was difficult). There was a slight discrepency with the price of parking our car, but the hotel researched the web-site where we saw the cheaper parking price and honored that price, no questions asked! As we were getting settled, housekeeping brought my roommate and myself a bag of extra toiletries (which are Aveda products-- What a nice change from the typical drugstore brands!).The room was roomy enough  the beds were comfortable beyond belief! Not to mention that we walked to 5th Ave, Madison Ave, and Times Square numerous times a day. It was only about a $12 taxi ride to Grenwich Village, Soho, Chinatown, and Little Italy. A very convenient hotel (especially for the price)!I would stay at the Affinia 50 again in a hearbeat! I really cannot say anything negative about our hotel stay! I highly recommend the Affinia 50.

<Author>hoovlet
<Content>Disappointing My boyfriend and I stayed at the Affinia the night of Feb 17, 2007, for a quick getaway. My heart sank when we walked into the room. It was was bare and small with a tiny window at least a foot above eye-level. Yes, there was a minibar, and a TV with a movie selection. The view I'd been looking forward to was of a chunk of a brick wall about 2 feet away from our window. The minibar was empty, and none of the listed movies were available for viewing, for some mysterious reason. We called about the movies, to no avail. We had no control of the temperature in the room, and the window did not open. We called for a fan, and it was, in fact, delivered. It performed passably in creating a modicum of airflow in the stuffy atmosphere of the room. They did have Aveda shampoo and soap, however, so at least I got to take some good products home. And the location was convenient--I got a nice manicure at the excellent Bliss spa, very nearby.FYI, our room was on the second floor--just make sure you ask about your view.

<Author>Knows
<Content>Our own NYC apartment! My two children and I recently stayed five nights at the Affinia 50, having booked a one bedroom suite on line. The high rating and positive reviews on tripadvisor were the reason I chose this property. Our rate varied from $289 Sunday to $379 Wed/Thurs. which I felt was great for the area and space. The one bedroom suite was very large and accommodating; plenty of closet space and drawers. I was very pleased with the unkeep, furniture and linen. It's not luxurious, but not cheap and shabby either. The Aveda products were a plus. The kitchen was a bit old, but functional and clean. We had everything we needed and more!The location was perfect for walking to Rockefellar plaza, Times Sq., Central Park, shopping and dining. We ate breakfast every morning at the Morning Star Cafe, which was right around the corner. A much better deal than the Lunceonette beside the hotel. We ordered in a couple nights and ate out the rest of the time. A big help is menupages.com - it lists every restuarant by neighborhood, their menus and reviews. Invaluable when in the city.

<Author>jng06
<Content>Beautiful hotel! Just got back from a girls weekend in New York. We struggled to get an affordable place for 2 nights and my friend scored a great rate for this hotel. Based on good reviews from trip advisor, we headed to the big city. This hotel did not disappoint....It felt like a vacation in itself - very clean and contemporary decor. The beds and pillows were so so comfortable (and did I mention clean?). We got upgraded to a small suite that had a tiny, but fully filled kitchen and also a large desk that would have been great had we been there for business. We were able to use (for a fee) the computer and printer in their business center and they had a lovely lounge area where we waited a little for the room to be ready (we were early..not their fault).Look at the location on a map before you decide - it was very near to a subway line and not a huge walk to broadway, MOMA, Grand Central station, etc.. (we have good walking legs, though)I would definitely stay here again.

<Author>MHSanFrancisco
<Content>A real find After reading all the positive reviews of this property, and knowing we would be centrally located with extraordinary space for the price, we were primed for disappointment - which did NOT happen! If you are looking for spacious rooms, great location, and excellent service - and, who isn't - this hotel is for you. Our 'junior suite' was easily twice the size of an ordinary hotel room, especially in expensive NYC, yet at half the cost you would expect. Our two daugters shared an ordinary hotel room here as well, with a tariff only somewhat below expected for the size and location, but were also very happy.The managers put us into a street-side room at first, which has the advantage of the view but the disadvantage of noise. I called downstairs at near midnight (when a bus pulled up and sounded his air horn!) to ask for an inside room change. They responded immediately, found a room on the same floor (but even larger!), and offered to help us move! The elevators, often an Achilles heel of hotels, especially smaller ones, worked remarkably well - fast and efficient. The exercise room appears to be new, with 2 new Life Cycles (both with heart rate monitors) - one upright, one recumbant - both with toe straps, a real rarity. You will be hard-pressed to find this anywhere else in the City. The breakfast facility is very nicely furnished, but serves only a continental for $15. When we wanted full breakfasts, the hotel staff itself directed us to the 'luncheonette', 50 meters up the block, which was about $10. But, the kichenettes, equipped with service for 4, make it easily possible for you to provide your own, for a lot less. And, despite the very friendly and helpful staff, there was none of the usual discomfort found in larger hotels, I mean the shilling for tips. At no point did we feel under this distasteful pressure.Be aware that the internet will cost you about $10/day, but, at their room rates, you can hardly complain. You will not find here the luxurious, and often useless, amenities, such as terricloth bathrobes and slippers. And, if you are looking for a large lobby, or a grand atrium, look elsewhere (and expect to hear your wallet complain).No property is perfect in every respect, of course. My two criticisms, though, are very minor: The hot water took a very long time to become hot from the sink faucet (something amiss with their recirculation system). And, the A/C was too noisy until I 'adjusted' the knobless fan speed with my faithful Leatherman toolkit, whereupon it was close to perfect. Overall, though, this is a definite winner, and one I will use whenever i find myself in this city.  
<Date>Mar 7, 2007

<Author>spp-dc
<Content>Great hotel for business travel I love this hotel! I travel a lot with work, and most often stay in places like Hiltons and Marriotts It's so refreshing to stay in a lovely, clean, well-appointed and elegant hotel in Manhattan that is not a Marriott and doesn't cost a fortune.Some of the rooms are small here, but I got lucky and was placed in a double with a kitchen. I can't wait to come back on a weekend with my husband and sons - it's ideal (and a million times more comfortable than the awful room we had in Sept. at the Marriott East Side one block away...what a bad experience).Have also stayed at the Affinia Dumont which is great - but this is a better location for me, and just as nice. And, I love the Benjamin, on this same block, but it is usually considerably more expensive and often there are no available rooms.All in all, this is my new favorite hotel, and hotel group, in NYC.

<Author>ManchesterM-Man
<Content>Superb Service My wife and I just returned from 5 nights at the Affinia.It was excellent. The location to both the sights and the subway cannot be bettered.On our arrival we were immediately upgraded to a better room which was spacious and clean and had a great view of the hustle and bustle of Midtown.The staff were very friendly and happy and really made you feel looked after. The welcome home greeting you receive from the staff when you return from a day out is a really nice touch.The cafe a few doors down is excellent and Mint, the Indian restaurant just across the road was one of the best places we ate at.Our one small gripe was that the ceiling above the bath leaked (presumably when the occupants of the room above showered). We told reception and they said they had fixed it, but it looked as though it continued to leak.All in all, though, we would highly recommend the Affinia.

<Author>ardmayle
<Content>Excellent Hotel. Thanks to Tripadvisor!! I just arrived back from NY today! I booked my long weekend at the Affinia 50 because of the reviews on this site and the balance of price, hotel and room quality, and location. The hotel is in a superb location, right behind the Waldorf Astoria. I walked from Grand Central Station in under 15 minutes and was greeted very warmly at the front desk. I was upgraded from a double room to a Junior Suite, at no cost, and the man gave me a map explaining where I was in relation to the major attractions.The suite was spotless, clean, of ample size, nicely decorated and warm. It was exactly as it appears on the Affinia website, in fact. I was on the ninth floor, facing the street, (some of the rooms must face 3rd Avenue, which has to be slightly noisier). It was my birthday the day before my arrival. I was delighted to find a huge chocolate cake in the fridge and a bottle of very drinkable Merlot on the table, with a note wishing me a happy birthday. I received two phone calls in the first hour of my stay, from hotel staff, introducing themselves and offering their assistance, should I need it. They also wished me happy birthday... It doesn't get much better than this. I wouldn't dream of booking anywhere else if I went back.

<Author>rico4200
<Content>Great Apartment Style Room - Excellent View. Just Wonderful !!! My daughter had to go to New York for college dance auditions and I wanted a room with a kitchen for convenience and enough room for my husband, daughter and I to feel comfortable. I was so pleasantly surprised with the size of the Rooms at the Affinia 50. We were in the 1 bedroom guest room and it was just wonderful. Very nice living area with nice modern furniture and a dining table for 4 people. Small galley style kitchen, not very modern, but still quite adequate and convenient. with a dishwaser, refrigerator, stove and microwave. The kitchen cabinets were adequately stocked with silverware and glasses, cups, etc. Everything was in good condition and very clean. The only thing I didn't like was the small size hotel room coffee pot. Although packets of coffee were provided to make the small pot of coffee, I would have preferred a full size coffee pot. That is truly my only complaint and that is only because I knew we would have a full kitchen and I brought my own coffee and filters. I like my own coffee and I don't care for those small coffee pots with the premeasured packs of coffee. I'm a picky coffee drinker. The view from our window was spectacular. We could look out the large window in the living room down on the street and see all the activity. We were in easy walking distance to Rockafeller center and Time Square. There are many stores and restaurants close by including a McDonalds and drug store right around the corner which were so convenient. The staff was extremely attentive and polite. I would highly recommend this hotel. Parking was a breeze even though the street was quite crowded to pull up to the front of the hotel. We simply pulled up as close as we could to the curb and we were immediately greeted by someone to help us. Our car was immediately valet parked and we were on our way to check into our room. Absolutey great staff at the Affinia every step of he way. Both doormen that we encountered during our stay were so friendly and just simply wonderful men. Talkative and friendly in every regard. They made use feel welcome. Our room was quite large by any standard, much less New York. I have stayed in just a one room guest room with two beds in other hotels in NYC and paid a comparable price or a higher price and this room was so much bigger and more functional for a family or for a couple. The one bedroom suite is worth every penny and more. It is well appointed and quite large with a separate bedroom..... and the bed was just heavenly. Very comfortable and plush. I highly recommend this hotel. I have stayed in many hotels in New York and this is truly a great place for the price. Worth every penny. Convenient location, easy parking, great staff, and absolutely lovely accomodations. I thoroughly loved my stay. Couldn't ask for much more.

<Author>mattman26
<Content>Worthwhile if they hold the prices My room was almost absurdly large, particularly for this (or any other) area of Manhattan. Nothing was absolutely top-notch, but everything about the property was at least decent; cleanliness, bed quality, etc.One problem that wasn't handled as well as I would have liked. Around 8:15 one morning, I headed for the shower before a 9 o'clock meeting. No hot water; none. I called the front desk, and they sounded puzzled; said they would check with engineering. 15 minutes later, no response, and still no hot water. I called the front desk again, and they seemed even more shocked; said they would send engineering up to my room. 15 or 20 minutes later, still nothing, and still no hot water. I called again, and the manager told me it was a mechanical problem and the whole hotel had no hot water, and beyond that they really didn't know what to tell me. I was pretty steamed (ha!); took a bracing cold shower, got dressed, and then the manager called to tell me the hot water was back!Part of me thinks this could happen anywhere, but the fact of the matter is it generally doesn't, and that makes me wonder if their overall physical plant is as well maintained as it ought to be. The manager was pretty nice, and it was nice of him to call me back when the hot water returned (although it was too late for me), but the overall confusion and non-responsiveness through my first couple phone calls were aggravating. He took a big chunk off my bill, but I'd have rather had the hot shower!Business center on the 2d floor has a couple computers and a printer, which is handy, although the computer (which you pay for with a credit card swipe) was not the most user friendly system, and the printer (a Brother inkjet) just sucked.Still, for rooms this big, in this location, and particularly if the prices stay modest, this place is definitely worth consideration.  
<Date>Feb 10, 2007

<Author>Jenraf
<Content>Big comfortable bed We spend 5 nights here in Feb 2007. The room was large and comfortable. There were many nice touches including- fridge, nice toiletries and large TV. We had a standard double with a hugh comfortable bed. The view was poor- we were on the 3rd floor at the back with the air con units, but I think that was bad luck. It didn't ruin the say. The lounge was comfortable and inviting and the wine and cheese a lovely touch. We mainly used it on the last day after checking out, meaning we could enjoy our last day knowing we ad somewhere warm to come back too.The staff were very helpful and welcoming.Several blocks east of rockafella centre it was a good base for exploring. Its not right in the centre of things but benefits from a quieter location.We wouldn't recommend the airport shuttle the hotel uses- very poor service from the driver.There is a nice cafe 3 doors down which does a nice breakfast/lunch.

<Author>lovetravelmontreal
<Content>Great hotel We just came back from New York City where we spent 3 nights at the Affinia 50. The rooms are quite spacious for New York and for the price. We had a king size bed, a fridge, and a coffee maker. The bathroom is a decent size, except it had only a vent and not a fan. Minor detail. The staff, the service, and the location are all wonderful. Many places to eat in the area, and close to all the major attractions. A great place for breakfast is the Morning Star Cafe, on 2nd Avenue and 50th Street. Would go back to this hotel next time in New York.

<Author>Tellurian
<Content>Comfort and Convenience Although the Affinia 50 offers many services, it shines most brightly for the independent traveler looking for a comfortable, spacious, conveniently-located base in New York City -- not travelers looking to be pampered at every turn. The beds are great, Aveda toiletries distinctive, staff friendly and location excellent. You won't get unforgettable views, robes, a mini-bar or chocolates on your pillow, but (in a studio or suite) you will enjoy plenty of room to work or lounge, a kitchen to keep refreshments or that caviar you bought to take home, and wonderful linens to enhance your sweet dreams.

<Author>golfingal
<Content>Just what you need for a great, up-to-date midtown hotel On 50th, between Lex and 3rd, the Affinia 50 feels brand new inside. Spacious rooms, clean and contemporary design. Having stayed in too many old, drab and worn out hotels in Manhattan, it was a delight to find everything new and clean - from the decor in the rooms to the equipment in the fitness center. It was a good valye at the rates we found through Expedia (in January - not exactly high season). I thought the $14 continental breafast was grossly overpriced, and with all the stores on 3rd and pubs on 2nd, the lack of in-hotel dining was not an issue.

Two adults, two children in a one bedroom suite.Pros: really large room, two queens in the bedroom and a pull out in the living room, great comfy beds, prompt maid service and good location.Cons: all the common areas are really small (really small) with low celings and everything needs a good scrub, thankfully we were on the 6th floor because we took the stairs (even at checkout w- 4 suitcases) most of our stay, the 2 elevators are very slow, the front desk seems overwhelemed and put out, could not make change for larger bills or arrange for cars, we only saw the door man once during our stay (but was very helpful that one time) and don't even try the coin op laundry, it's just plain scary.I will mention we did not get a deal, we paid $398.00 a night, not again.

<Author>ghustonus
<Content>NYC Home Stayed at this hotel in midtown Manhattan just after New Years during the recent heat wave. Hotel was clean and price was decent for this quality hotel in NYC. Since we stayed more than 3 nights we got an additional 20% off through Expedia. Room was 2 large beds with a small Kitchenette. One day when we returned the doorman said welcome home. Our room on the seventh floor had some minor things such as a bedlight missing from one of the beds (had obviously been ripped out) and the temperature controls didn't seem to have much effect. The staff was very helpful when asked about directions or any of our needs. My only real complaint was that the shampoo and conditioners were not replenished the first night and neither was the coffee. Both of these items were quickly remedied when I brought it to their attention. The room was a little loud from street noise. Their is a club of some type right nest door that must be popular since draws crowds late at night. Beds were very comfortable and all in all would stay here again. Location is excellent with Subway nearby and within easy walking distance of 5th avenue stores and Rockefeller Center.

<Author>sailorgirlmn
<Content>Mixed but overall good value I stayed at the Affinia 50 the first week in January. The room was booked through Hotels.com and had rates ranging between $140 and $190 during my stay. I spent one weekend night at a sister property - The Benjamin - which may be why I was a bit disappointed in my experience at Affinia 50. Don't get me wrong, overall it's a very nice hotel and a good value for the money. The location can't be beat at 50th and Third- close to the subway, walkable to shopping and museums and the midtown business area. I arrived around 1pm (2 hours before the 3pm check-in). The hotel was obviously busy, but I asked if I could check in early and the person at the reception told me to go up to their 2nd floor lounge (nice place to to hang out, have breakfast or a cocktail) to wait and they would get me when a room was ready. I was there over an hour (much longer than I would have expected when I was there waiting...). If one of the managers hadn't come by and noticed I was still there, I'm not sure how long I would have been kept waiting. When I finally got into my room I was pleasantly surprised by the large (by NYC standards) room with its modern updates. The room faced out to the corner of 50th and 3rd but was surprisingly quiet. With the exception of the initial front desk experience, service at the hotel is friendly, quick and professional. I appreciated the in-room safe and the small refrigerator.Overall I would recommend the hotel as a very good value for the money and a nice change from large chain hotels.  
<Date>Jan 15, 2007

<Author>jlc4
<Content>This is how hotels should be. Every time I stay at an Affinia property I am more and more impressed. The rates were fantastic for midtown (granted early January is not the hot tourist season, but it was unseasonably warm - in the 60's and 70's) and the valet parking reasonable. The staff of the Affinia 50 is welcoming, personable and unobtrusive. This is how hotels should be.

<Author>PoblanoJ
<Content>A Great Stay We stayed in a standard room with a queen size bed. Room was relatively large. Bed was VERY comfortable. We sampled some of the pillows from their pillow menu and found that the buckwheat pillows made for an amazing night's sleep. Room was spotlessly clean with an upscale feel, nice Aveda toiletries, good quality towels, CD player onthe nightstand, nice TV, comfortable work area, and an especially-welcome, small refrigerator to store our own food (rather than a mini-bar with overpriced things we don't want.) The helpful and knowledgeable doormen were not always present, but when they were, we were greeted with a Welcome Home and a Cheers. The complimentary wine and cheese in the club room was nice on weekday evenings. The concierge was helpful with restaurant recommendations. The exercise room had high-end equipment and was clean and well-maintained and had a shower and changing room. The staff was efficient and cheerful. Location is very central (a block and a half from the 4,5,6 subway). As long as the price is right, I'd like to stay here again.  
<Date>Jan 9, 2007

<Author>occmed
<Content>Amazing hotel!!!! I picked the Affinia chain because of the amazing reviews on TripAdvisor and was not at all disappointed. We ( 2 adults, 2 kids, 12 and 15) stayed in a Junior Suite, with 2 queen beds. Tons of room, and not just by New York standards. Beautifully finished, great beds, comforters and terrific bathroom and toiletries. Room to set up your computer on a rather large desk and a very useful, but very small kitchen, with a stove, fridge, sink, dishware, pots, toaster, microwave all supplied. Only issue is that if you are plannin on eating in a Junior Suite, there is not really anywhere to sit around a table. There is a chair and ottoman and then the beds. Great TV, tons of storage. Great and helpful staff. We were a bit worried about the location at 50th and 3rd, but no concerns. Walked to the theatres in about 20 minutes. Also very close to at least 2 subway stops. We got a great deal by taking a non-refundable rate from the hotel's website itself and saved a bunch of money. In short....stay here...you won't be disappointed.  
<Date>Jan 7, 2007

<Content>Very well located Three of us stayed at the hotel over Christmas for 5 nights in a one-bedroom apartment. The hotel is very well situated on E50th and Third in Midtown. The apartment was clean, spacious and very comfortable. As we had a kitchen we ate breakfast in the apartment so are unable to comment on the breakfasts on the Club floor. There is a supermarket a block away and the area is well served with diners and restaurants. The concierge service was excellent and the reception staff and doormen friendly and helpful. We would certainly use the hotel next time we are in New York.If you can't face the huge museums try the Frick which has an amazing collection of European art and is relatively small.

<Content>Absolutely wonderful stay at the Affinia 50! We had a one night stay at the Affinia 50 on Christmas night. Arrived late, but were welcomed with open arms and no wait. Can't say enough good things about this hotel. Great for families - we were traveling with two teenagers and it was great. Great location - even a Starbucks on the corner. Would not stay anywhere else in Manhattan.

<Author>chrispr3
<Content>We loved it! We stayed at the Affinia 50 for one night - Dec 22 to 23rd - the very busy, last weekend before Christmas. Our stay here was a pleasant surprise. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. It is particularly nice for business travelers or families who want larger, suite-type accommodations.We learned about the hotel through a low rates type travel e-mail, and booked a King bed + sofabed room for a very good rate. Upon arriving, the reception staff discovered we had children with us and immediately upgraded us to a HUGE corner suite. We didn't even ask! No extra charge! The suite was amazing - clean and HUGE. Separate kitchen area with a stove, fridge/freezer, microwave, dishwasher, dishes, etc. Enormous living room area with the pull-out sofa already made up for our kids and 19th floor City views along two walls. Eating area with a dining table that sat four. Plenty of closet and drawer space - even a small walk-in closet. Our kids thought they were movie stars, the place was that nice. Our bedroom was equally spacious and well appointed. Large screen TVs in both rooms and high end grooming products in the bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and the rooms were quiet. The Website description and photos really didn't do the place justice. Every staff member that we encountered was very polite and nice, and even apologized for getting on to the elevator with us. We did not have to wait to check in, check out, check our baggage, or get an elevator. And as I mentioned previously, this was peak Christmas season in NYC - we anticipated large crowds, long waits and plenty of rude NY citizens and staff. We encountered none of these. If I need to find any flaws with this establishment (and I really have to think hard...) I would say that there was a little bit of water damage in the bathroom, but nothing that affected the cleanliness of it - there was no mildew or antiquated bathtub caulk - and the bathroom was on the smaller size. But in NYC, I expect things to be a little on the efficient, space-saving side. The other thing I noted was that the cabinets in the kitchen were on the low-budget side, but I was so tickled to even have a kitchen in my suite, I really didn't care! I did not take note of the decor; everything seemed tastefully done to me and the furniture was of nice quality; nothing stood out as old or tacky.The location is IDEAL. It is a couple of blocks from Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's, Radio City, the great shopping on Fifth Avenue, etc. We had 9AM tickets for the Christmas Spectacular at Radio City, and all we had to do was walk out the front door, turn right, walk 4 blocks and enter Radio City. The location made it easy for us to walk to the Sony Wonder Technology Lab  Museum and the Museum of Modern Art (both wonderful attractions and free on Friday nights!) There are great restaurants at all price levels and cuisine types a block away from the hotel, and even a McDonald's around the corner. If you drive into the City, the hotel offers valet parking at competitive rates, or there are lots on 50th or 51st streets. There is a subway station very close by, so you really don't need a car to get around.Again, I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone. It is particularly nice for business travelers or families who want larger, suite-type accommodations.  
<Date>Dec 26, 2006

<Author>Missy_in_MI
<Content>Wonderful Stay in Midtown We stayed 3 nights and 4 days at the Affinia 50 Hotel. This was our first trip to NYC and we had heard stories on how the hotels were small and not worth the money. This was not the case at Affinia 50. The room was excellent! We had plenty of space and the decor was modern and tasteful. The staff at the Affinia 50 were very helpful. The bell service set up shuttles for us, the concierge was very helpful in setting us up at restaurants and telling us about the attractions. We did have to ask for fresh wash cloths one day but they were brought up right away with an apology for them missing. The lounge area at the hotel was very nice and comfy too. Whenever we got back at the end of a long day we were greeted with a smile and a warm Welcome Home. I would definately go back to the Affinia 50 for our next trip to NYC. This is a great stay for anyone!

<Author>Shopaholiday
<Content>Smashing place Cannot recommend the Affinia 50 highly enough. Once again, Tripadvisor's reviewers are bang on with the ratings. Three of us stayed at the Affinia from 30 Nov to 4 Dec 2006. I booked back in May; knowing December was peak season, and reserved a junior suite, but on arrival we were upgraded to an enormous suite on the 14th floor because one of us was celebrating a birthday. You'd easily have slept six people in it. There were two large double beds in the bedroom and the living area had two sofas, one of which folded out into a double bed. It also had a dining table to seat 4. The rooms were spotlessly clean and well-equipped; two large TVs, separate kitchen with dishwasher and large fridge-freezer, and bathroom with (an admittedly small, but we didn't mind) bath and lovely fixtures and Aveda cosmetics. Hairdryer, iron and ironing board also provided. Staff were incredibly helpful; the doormen and receptionists were obliging and pleasant, and the concierge in the second floor club lounge, Tanya, was brilliant - organised tickets for sightseeing tours and also managed to get tickets to a sold-out show for us. Location great - less than 10 minutes' leisurely walk to the Rockefeller center, and very close to Saks, Bloomingdales, and Fifth and Madison Avenues. We walked everywhere - didn't need to use the subway and only got taxis when going to the Port Authority or airport.The Affinia doesn't have a restaurant (it serves breakfast in the club room, but we didn't indulge), but there are plenty of dining options nearby. The New York Luncheonette two doors up does great breakfasts (you might have to queue to get in for a few minutes at weekends but it's worth it), and Ferro's Italian restaurant further up in the Kimberly hotel wasn't bad. I gather Smith and Wollensky's steakhouse down the street is great but we didn't make it there. If I had to find a negative it would be that there was a bit of noise from aircon units outside the windows, but it didn't bother us at all after the first night. Also, you might have to wait a few minutes for the lifts at check-in/check-out times. All in all, a great stay. I would book it again without hesitation.  
<Date>Dec 8, 2006

<Author>AmieB
<Content>Brilliant!!!!! What a lovely hotel. This was our first time in NY and we cant wait to go back. We arrived on Fri 1st Dec around 5.30pm, to find our room wasn't ready, all though we only had to wait around 10 mins i would of expected us to be able to go straight in. Never the less the reception were lovely, they made us welcome with friendly smiles and the door men are brilliant. They are really helpful and will get you taxis, book helicopters flights, do anything you need - obviously they expect a tip after!! But they make the stay all the better.We had booked a king size suite and that it was!! It was massive. The front room was huge with dining table at the end of it. The tv was gigantic! The kitchen was small and dated but then we only used it for the fridge and kettle. We weren't planning on eating in any night! The bathroom again is small but lovely and clean. The bedroom was huge. The bed was gigantic and could of fit 4 of us!!! It was so comfy i didn't want to get out. We had loads of cupboards/wardrobes space. We faced out onto the street which we loved. All though u can here the traffic late at night we didn;t mind as we wanted to watch it all going on. If your a light sleeper then i;d ask for a room at the back if noise bothers you. We'd had a few drinks before going to bed so we slept through it. Mon - Thurs they have free wine, coffee etc on the 2nd floor which is a nice touch, all though we didn't go there.This hotel is in a great location for anyone to get about NY city. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant like most of them dont, but with the cafe a few doors down delivering to the hotel free of charge your sorted for breakfast. We would def come back and stay at this hotel and recommend it to anyone  
<Date>Dec 6, 2006

<Author>JTB9110
<Content>Excellent Location !!! The Affinia 50 was a very pleasant place to stay for a long weekend in the Big Apple. The location is excellent, 50th and 3rd Ave is a nice part of the Upper East Side. The subay was quite close and Rockefeller Center just down the street. The Guestroom was spacious and mine included a mini fridge. Thank goodness it did not have one of those sensor activated minibars that I think should be outlawed! The Living Room on the second floor ( right down from my Guestroom) was a nice place...had free coffee and tea and a computer with the internet to check email and bank balances ( NYC is expensive! ) . I would definitely reconsider staying here again, but hopefully at less than 350 a night. But Christmas time is always expensive in NYC.

<Author>inspectorc
<Content>Affinia wonderful We have just returned from The Affinia and it exceeded expectations. We stayed in a Queen room on the 5th floor, we didn't have a street view but as we were in New York to sight see this didn't bother us. The room was clean, the bed was soooo comfortable the bed linen was lovely and crisp, we didn't bother with the pillow menu as the ones we had were comfy enough. The bathroom was small but spotless. It was wonderful to have a fridge to keep drinks cool and also a coffee maker, (not often found in New York hotel rooms). All the staff were helpful especially the doormen who always greeted us with a smile. We would definitely use this hotel again.

<Author>travellrp
<Content>Huge rooms; good stay; great with kids Good: Family (2 adults and 2 kids) stayed in 1 bedroom suite there this weekend. Overall, a great stay. The rooms were huge. Really, for New York, HUGE. The beds were comfortable and the linens were nice. The location is good--very close to the subway, walking distance to many good restaurants and sites, and safe. We had an interior room with a bit of a dismal view (backs of other hotels) but on the 12th floor it was super quiet. We were also on an end and heard virtually no other guests. The staff was nice and responsive--especially the doormen.Bad: The kitchen was comically dated. It had metal cabinets that barely opened! The dishwasher was 10 years old, at least. However, it was functional. It had 4 dishes, cups, etc. You wouldn't want to cook in it, but it was fine for feeding the kids and warming up take out. Also the rooms were warm as the heating is not per-unit controlled and NYC was unseasonably warm.Overall: I'd stay there in a second with kids. For adults, you could probably find somewhere a little cooler or more romantic for the same money but for a family the huge rooms and kitchen were great.  
<Date>Nov 15, 2006

<Content>Friendly staff and great location Stayed at the Affinia 50 for 9 nights in late October - early November 2006. <Author>bunnyv24
<Content>just as good as expected! I stayed here from 10/27/06-10/30/06 with three other women and had a standard room w/two beds. It's very small, but was very, very clean. The beds were very comfortable (for a hotel)  i didnt feel scared to sleep on them. The staff was also very curteous. Another good thing about it is that it's only a 20 min walk (or so) to times square/broadway, which is cool if it's your first time to see all the lights! We went to see Evil Dead the musical (which was excellent!)  we were also able to walk there. Gave 4 stars instead of 5 because room was so small  we were in room 211 which is in a weird area by the lounge  fitness room  elevator so we heard the elevator  people all night long. This only bothered me 'cause i'm a light sleeper. If your a heavy sleeper wouldnt bother you as it didnt the people i was with. Just avoid this room! Would definitely recommend for small groups travelling on a budget!

<Author>LorieP
<Content>Loved the Affinia 50 My niece and I planned a trip to the American Girl Store in NYC. By the time we traveled (Oct 12-16), her mom  my son and his wife had joined us and we needed a suite. The AGS recommended the Affinia as a partner with them. The Hotel was close to the store, Grand Central and St. Patrick's Cathredal. We were impressed with the men at the door who made us very comfortable, were willing to talk to us and were very informative.Our only complaint was that the hotel was out of beds for the dolls that travelled with us - we did find that the oversized, beautiful burgundy pillows worked well for their bed. The hotel also gave us a choice of pillows that we could request and comfortable beds. We were close to the subway and to eateries for a quick lunch or a very late snack. We were impressed with the small kitchen that had everything we needed for our leftovers as well as a corkscrew. All of us will plan to stay there on our next trip to NYC.

<Author>traderdoll
<Content>Loved the Price and Accommodations at the Affinia 50 Hitting peak season in NYC can be very expensive. I stayed at the Affinia 50 on 3rd and 50th since the Grand Hyatt was charging $550 for a standard room (ridiculous)...I found the accomodations at the Affinia 50 were 100% better than I ever expected. I loved the in-room kitchen complete with flatware, tableware, including wine glasses!!! Also included were a refrigerator, microwave, stove etc. The hotel offers Aveda soaps, shampoo and conditioner which was a nice touch. Honestly, if you compare standard room to standard room the Affinia 50 makes the Hyatt look like a 2 star hotel...The front desk was friendly and very accommodating! Would definitely do the Affinia 50 again! Only bad thing was the street noise I was in room 804 and the noise from 3rd Avenue mainly sirens and cars honking...Well welcome to Manhattan... ;o)

<Author>thedoctors
<Content>great hotel We stayed here for 8 nights in oct 06, we had a gorgeous junior suite room (2 of us)n lots of space, didn't use the sofa bed as a bed tho' what with the fantastic double bed they provided us with. Huge mirror which was great for getting ready in the evenings! Bathroom was a bit small and kitchen even smaller, but to be fair we did'nt use the latter. The fact that the bathroom was equally gorgeous (with Aveda goodies) and clean more than made up for the lack of size. Room on the whole was v.clean and furniture in great condition- had a nice view too.We were on the 14th floor and during the night you could here some noise but on the whole it was not loud enough to be troublesome.For breakfasts try the yummy Pax around the corner or also Ess-a-bagel next door to it!51st street tube is one a block away; have to say the hotel could not be in a better location, this is my fourth time to New York and I have to say the city is small enough to be easily navigated by all means of transport (including by foot)The staff are absolutely lovely and very helpful, one last thing do not end your stay without visiting Whiskey Blue bar in the W hotel (around the corner)- really nice!

<Content>Great location, comfortable large rooms Arrived in New York on 6th Oct for 3 nights at the Affinia 50 hotel. Arrived at Newark and pre-booked Blue Van transfer which is reasonable priced and good service, just got to 鈥済round transport desk鈥?when you arrive and they do the rest. Booked a suite at the hotel, great room could not fault it in any way, the separate lounge and kitchen area was a god send, especially if you get a bit of jet lag and up at 3am. Hotel is in a good location and many attractions can be walked to, also the metro is 5 mins walk. Metro can be a little confusing at first but you will soon get into it.We did not have breakfast in the hotel as many cheaper places around the area. There is no bar at the hotel, which is a shame, but a nice club lounge area with complimentary tea and coffee all day. You can get a 鈥渨alking tour鈥?kit from the hotel, which is a really good idea (maps, CDs, books, water container etc all in a small back pack)Just a word of warning we had a few items stolen from our bags during our return journey, cannot be sure at what point they went missing!! But keep this in mind!!  
<Date>Oct 18, 2006

<Author>GMWolff
<Content>Not what I expected Having never been to New York before, I (sadly) assumed the worst about the hotel accommodations. Business travelers had warned me about the room sizes and even suggested I pack light because there wouldn't be room for anything extra. Imagine my surprise when I checked into the Affinia 50 with three girlfriends this summer for a girls-only weekend! It is a beautiful hotel with lovely, roomy accommodations, fantastically comfortable beds, a pillow menu (in case you're super picky) and a very friendly staff. They were always ready to answer our questions and seemed happy to be there, even long past midnight when we'd return half asleep from our nightly excursions. I highly recommend this hotel.

<Author>olette49
<Content>Good 'Cheers' My family of 4 (2 adults and 2 teens spent 2 nights at the Affinia 50 recently. While not luxiourious, the amenities that mattered were right on and service was always very friendly, served with a smile, a tip of the hat from the bellman and a good day Cheers. (my suburban-raised teen wanted to know why the bellmen were wearing cowboy hats. They were 50's style fedora's, which, the bellman explained, used to be a sign of a well-dressed man.) We used the valet parking service ($44/day for a minivan) which was very convenient. The room was a one bedroom apt. with a full kitchen. Two gloriously comfortable queen beds in the spacious bedroom, a sleep sofa in the large living room with plenty of room for a comfy cot. The unit could easily have slept 7 people (although the hotel might not want that). The kitchen still had its old metal cabinets, but was very clean and adequate for simple meal preps. Upscale Aveeda toiletries. The 2nd level club floor is open to all and features couches, large TVs, free newspapers and a continental breakfast (which should be skipped; go to Ess-a-Bagel on 3rd between 50th and 51st instead - great NY bagels served up by the gruff/funny/endearing staff; 4 bagels with toppings and drinks for the price of one continental breakfast). My only other (minor) grip with not having free Internet service. But all-in-all, a great little hotel for families doing NYC for the weekend.  
<Date>Oct 14, 2006

<Author>Leodiensian
<Content>Excellent value and location Arrived and was pleased by the friendly reception staff. Smallish lobby is smart and topped off by a steel waterfall originating in the Club Room on the floor above.The Affinia website isn't particulary clear, I thought this was an all suite hotel, but it isn't. I had a standard queen room. I was expecting a small kitchen but there wasn't one. No problem though.The room was a good size, especially for New York, and the fittings were of a 3* or 4* standard. Good sized bathroom with marble surfaces. Aveda products are excellent.Good sized closet (although, as a man, I ignored it and lived out of my bag).Bed was exceptionally comfortable with a pillow top mattress (basically a layer of pillow padding across the mattress). There is a slightly gimmicky pillow menu where one can choose from three of four pillow options. Again, I am male, and was staying alone, so ignored, it.I didn't use the Club Room so can't comment. Don't go for the $14 breakfast (not included in room rates). There are a million places in Manhattan to go for a better (and better value) breakfast. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but there IS room service from a restaurant (MINT) across the street.I was in room 405. This was obviously on the 4th floor. You can hear some noise from 3rd avenue, but it didn't bother me. The view from rooms on this side of the hotel isn't that great - just a brick wall. I could see 3rd avenue at an angle, but again, no real problem.Location is excellent. Turn right out of the hotel and 10 mins later you are at the Rockerfeller Center, 15 mins and you are just north of Times Square. Great deli around the corner to the right outside the hotel, or a larger supermarket (Associated) on Second Avenue (south a bit).I booked this as part of a deal with flight from the UK, so I couldn't see the hotel price, but I expect it was about $150 - $200. At that price it's great value. Don't hesitate to book this hotel if you can get it at less than $250 a night.  
<Date>Oct 4, 2006

<Author>mickeykitty
<Content>great for a family As far as NYC hotels go, this one is average, or above average, but I rated it excellent because it could meet the needs of our family of five. It has several suite options which include a sofa bed and the kitchen was an added bonus. I booked through AAA because it would give me an option of what turned out to be the junior suite for $288, while the Affinia website would only put 5 people in a one bedroom suite for $405. While this would still be a pretty good deal for NYC, I was happy to save the extra money. The staff was especially polite and helpful. We would definately stay there again.

<Author>KareBear
<Content>Great location and ammenities but pricey My family stayed at the Affinia 50 September 23 - 28th. It was me, my husband, daughter 16 and son 12. We had the 1 bedroom suite. It included 2 queen beds and a pull out bed. It also had the kitchenette, 2 closets, safe, couch, etc. This was plenty of room for us and it worked out well. Everything was very clean and nice. Very few, minor issues like not providing enough towels to not turning down the fold-out bed the first night only, but the rest of the time they were spot on.What I loved about this hotel was its great location in midtown. So easy to get everywhere around Manhattan. I also have to give big kudos to the door staff. They were so friendly and helpful and I felt like I was leaving family as they waved as we went home in our taxi.Although this hotel was a bit pricey, I don't feel bad about spending the money. I think it was worth it. We definitely used the kitchenette to have breakfast, snacks and soda on hand which was a big deal for us. There was a little market a couple of blocks away and a very small store just a few hundred feet down for emergencies.We will recommend this hotel to our friends and family due to its location, friendly staff and the added benefit of the kitchenette and space for families.

<Author>kkinne
<Content>Very Nice - But Expensive Stayed at the Affinia 50 for business. Paid more than $600/night because there was nothing else available. Room was very large and comfortable. Had a living room, kitchenette, bedroom and large bathroom. Only downside was the low-flow shower that had very little water pressure. Plenty of space to work and the high-speed internet was terrific for $10/day. Overall, loved the room.The lobby and hallways are nothing special - very small, narrow and cramped -- but the staff is wonderful. From the minute that the doorman greets you with a tip of his cap until the time that you leave the hotel, the service is great.The location is perfect. Right off of Lexington and convenient to most everything in NY. Went running in Central Park early in the morning and it was about a 5 minute job to get there. The restaurants in the area are terrific. Very diverse selections -- from fast food all the way to high-end five-star cuisine. Times Square is a relatively short cab ride away and cost only $8 to get there. The subway also is very close (around the corner).NY is pricey throughout the city, so saving money may be difficult, but if you can get a good price for this hotel, you will not be disappointed.  
<Date>Sep 29, 2006

<Author>lonestarman
<Content>Small room, smaller bathroom The reviewers who wrote about the nice size of the rooms didn't stay in one of the guest rooms. I'm sure the suites are very nice, but the guest room is so small you have to close all the dresser drawers in order to get between the dresser and the bed. The bathroom was also tiny. You had to close the bathroom door just to have enough space to use the facilities and there was no shelf or countertop space. The room was clean and the staff was helpful, although I did have to call housekeeping twice to get a pillow from their pillow menu. The Club Room is very nice and the club concierge was wonderful. Be aware that the breakfast they serve in the Club Room is not included and is quite pricey for a glorified continental breakfast. It is clean, trendy and well located, but I was a little disappointed.

<Author>tidwell
<Content>Excellent Stay  The Affina 50 was a really nice hotel. The website pictures were accurate. The room was the right size. The bathroom however was a little small, but really cute. the bed was cozy and comfortable and I wish I had their pillows at my own home. The only thing we had a problem with was that our room was to close to the club room and the concierge desk. There was a lot of noise and activity in the hallway. Other than that, we would stay at the Affina 50 again. In fact, we are looking forward to visiting New York soon. We had a really great time in the city.  
<Date>Sep 21, 2006

<Author>LLSL
<Content>Sheer relief We booked Affinia 50 because it got such great reviews. Our journey to NY from London was marred by the terrorist threats over translatlantic flights - and the sheer relief of arriving in one piece was greatly increased by the warm welcome, and the very comfortable, spacious and quiet room we were given. The room was huge by normal hotel standards - and the beds were a delight. Best of all, in a noisy city, we faced the back (not a great view) and had no noise. Only drawback was that the airconditioning could not be adjusted or turned off and it did get quite cold sometimes. There is a diner just steps away for breakfast and a 24 hour supermarket round the corner. My son has already asked to stay there again if we return to NY- - which we will!

<Author>CaliGirl22
<Content>Comfy beds, clean hotel, great location First time to NYC, stayed at the Affinia 50 for six nights Aug-Sept. We had one of the 'cheap' room rates, 1-4 floors. No kitchenette like the description claimed, but it did have a small fridge. Did not bring it to their attention, as we were a night away from leaving. Book through AAA if you can, that way you get the best rate and you can always cancel. Just remodeled, nice rooms, best beds ever- that is important. Yes you will have to get your room key activated if you stay more than a few nights- happened here a few times, and in Boston- I think its an east coast thing..Great location, in my opinion. Would stay there again- for the price it can't be beat. All other hotels with good reviews were over $200 a night. Waldorf is a block away, if you want to spend over $400 a night. Here is my review/advice for those interested in details:Location was great. If you want a more quiet neighborhood at night, the outside is low on noise, except for cabs always honking. If you are looking for food in the a.m. McDonald's is on 3rd, literally 30 seconds away.DO NOT go to the breakfast place on 50th, the Luncheonette I think. Overpriced and the menu is misleading. We thought ten dollars, charged 20...fine print on the menu...Ugh.Ess-a-bagel (across from McD's) is great, busy in the a.m. but worth it for a cheap breakfast that will last till lunch time. Fabulous Mexican restaurant on 2nd Ave. Its a must. Mariachi band is great. Food is great. St. Bart's Church (on your way to Rock), great outdoor dining for dinner. Less than five minute walk.Subway is on 51st  Lexington, two minute walking distance. Starbucks is also right there. Always, always, always, carry a subway map and learn how to use it.Also invest in a Manhattan map so you get acquainted with how the streets work. They are VERY handy.Rockefeller Center is about a ten minute walk. Cab ride to Columbus Circle was $10, I think. Cab ride from JFK to Manhattan is a flate $45 plus bridge toll of $4.50If you like walking, Chrysler building is not too far. Ended up at the Empire State building, and Grand Central. Use the subway for Soho, Little Italy, Macys, Statue of Liberty, Ground Zero. It drops you off at all those places.-The doorman was the best part of the staff, always smiles and friendly. Housekeeping was noisey in the morning, and the slamming of doors will definitely wake you up.-Made it back for wine/cheese hour only once time, but it was great and relaxing.-We had a smaller room, huge king bed, but no complaints about the size since there were only 2 of us. -Bathrooms are SMALL. The faucet is ridiculous, couldn't wash my face without getting water everywhere. -Street noise was noticeable, but not as noticeable as the loud housekeeping early in the morning! I guess that is with all hotels though. Plus its NYC, cars are honking all day and all night!If its your first time, bring a lot of money for touristy things. Everything costs money. Food is expensive. Plan on at least $60 for dinner/two people. Oh, and bring comfy shoes. I did a LOT of research before booking this hotel, and I was not disappointed. Keep checking the price, mine went down after booking so I called AAA and got the lower price. Overall, LOVE NYC and want to come back soon!  
<Date>Sep 14, 2006

<Author>tomcat38
<Content>Problem Resolved Our reservation was made a month in advance with Expedia. We are not accustomed to spending $400 a night, but wanted our stay to be special and we even paid more for the one bedroom suite. Upon check in at 3:30 in the afternoon we were told that a guest had extended their stay and a suite was not available. There were three of us and we planned on having our son use the pull out couch in the living room. I told them I failed to see why tjhey were making their problem my problem. WE WERE TOLD BY THE SUPERVISOR it would only be for one night and that they would reduce our rate by $100 for each night. No one ever asked our opinion. We made it clear that this would be our first and last stay with Affinia 50. We were asked to consider eating at their breakfast $14.95 each.After arriving in our room a new manager called to offer us the breakfast for free. A nice offer, but we were still unsatisfied with the change to our accomodations. We never tried the breakfast. Soon thereafter another call to offer us a free bottle of wine. I told them it was not necessary, although they insisted (we never got it). After returning from sightseeing at 5 pm the next day we stopped at the front desk to see what they were doing about the change to our room. We were then upgraded to an even nicer room than we originally booked. An aside, the Television in the bedroom caught on fire soon after we got in the room. It was quickly replaced.In the end we appreciated the extra effort to make us happy. Although we still don't get why someone could extend their stay at our expense. The hotel is nice and well situated in the city. The bellman/parking attendant was terrific. (His name is Rome). He even recommended a nice Italian restaurant in walking distance of the hotel.In the end we agreed we would return due to the efforts continually made to try and make up for their mistake as opposed to just shrugging their shoulder after an attempt or two.. Both nights were charged at $199. Often the best way to rate a hotel is by how they handle the problems.  
<Date>Sep 6, 2006

<Author>JenAnnB
<Content>A great stay at the Affinia 50 We stayed at this wonderful hotel with our two children and small dog. We ALL had a wonderful time in NYC, mostly thanks to the exceptional hospitality of the Affinia 50. Our room was very spacious, with lots of closet space and a handy full size kitchen. It was great to be able to buy breakfast at a grocery store (there are several within easy walking distance) and have a convenient breakfast in the room.The Affinia 50 is in a great neighbourhood. It's a short walk to 5th Ave, and Central Park, but also on the edge of where it starts to get quieter and more neighbourly. Staying there was a great combination of feeling at home, and having ready access to the major attractions of NYC.And the staff was extra friendly and obliging. They really went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They also recommended some great restaurants in the neighbourhood.I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

<Author>yirg
<Content>highly recommended I was suprised by some of the negative comments on the last few reviews for this hotel . We (my husband and I and two teenage children) stayed at the Affinia 50 in July. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our 15th floor suite was extremely clean and large enough for 2 queen beds and a rollaway bed for our second daughter, the bathroom was a good size and there was more than adequate closet space. The kitchen was usful, but not really necessary as there are so many places to eat nearby. As a previous reviewer said the beds are some of the most comfortable I have ever slept on (I have back problems and I'm very very fussy), we did reciveve a pillow menu but didn't bother to change. We had no problems with noise from banging doors or voices in corridoors and street noise was at a perfectly acceptable level for a busy city (again noise is an area about which we are a fussy family as we take particular care to be quiet ourselves). All the staff were extremely helpful giving us recommndations for things to do, places to go, places to eat and directions. Would definately stay here again.Highly recommend Ess-a-bagel across the street for breakfast, and the Smith and Wollensky grill (on 49th and 3rd) for excellent steak.  
<Date>Aug 22, 2006

<Author>silviahg
<Content>I love New York, and the Affinia I was in New York in october, 2005. I didn't remember if I wrote my review. Anyway just few lines to express my total satisfaction for this hotel. As reviews I read said Affinia 50 is a perfect location for your journey. Well located, midtown, near underground stop, near baggels shop and starbucks, close to a supermarket... all the facilites. We had a very beautiful room in the 10th floor. I think the name was junior suite. We had two enormous beds, a kitchen (perfect for preparing breakfast or dinner if you decide to rest a litlle), at least 30 square metres I think. Hotel staff was nice, although I didn't need them a lot, just for asking for an electric switch to charge my european mobile. Just for your interest, we use airport shuttle for a company (the blue shuttle I thing, 8 usd per person more or less and they pick you up at the airport and pick you from the hotel to the airport) and it's a good alternative to a taxi, and cheaper. Coming back to Affinia, I'm looking for bad things, the breakfast price, maybe? As I've said you have lot of chance in the surroundings. Apart from that, I will return to Affinia when I return to New York, the best place I've ever stayed.  
<Date>Aug 20, 2006

<Author>mommy22girls
<Content>Comfortable stay Great price and great location, plus the most comfortable hotel beds my family has ever slept on. Check in went very smooth and the staff were courteous. Was a little disappointed in the fact that we booked the hotel back in February and requested a high floor and only got the 10th floor. No view from our room but heard no street noise.Had a leak in our fridge and the air conidtioner needed service. Maintenance was very prompt and fixed the air conditioner but was unable to fix the fridge, but it was still in working condition. If this is your first time in New York be sure to visit Tanya on the second floor and she can help you with anything - meals, locations, etc...We never received a menu to select our pillow type but we probably wouldn't have changed. Like I mentioned before the beds were great.My husband and two kids were with me and we walked everywhere from the hotel - Time Square and Central Park - so location was great.For meals be sure to eat at Pescatore's for great Italian (not too expensive) on 2nd. Tanya can give directions.Would I stay here again when we come back to New York - Absolutely!!! I highly recommend this hotel. I am so happy I found this thanks to tripadvisor.com.

<Author>KChampagne
<Content>Good location, clean comfortable rooms...but loud I recently spent 4 nights at the Affinia 50. We had booked a room with two queen beds and upon arriving discovered they had overbooked and only had a room with one king bed. We were offered a discount on the room rate so that was nice. The room was clean, nice sized, and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is only a couple of streets away from the subway so that is also a plus. The only complaint I had was the noise, and not the noise coming from the street. The doors to the rooms slam shut (even when you attempt to close them gently). You would think that with such heavy doors it would block out a lot of the hallway noise but that is not the case at all. I could hear every word that was said in the hallway by other guests and the maid service. Other than that it was a great place - just not for sleeping past 8am.  
<Date>Aug 19, 2006

<Author>Haddo
<Content>An adequate hotel This is advertised as an executive suite hotel and as such is oversold. The website is a perfect example of how carefully chosen photographs and sufficient hype can oversell a hotel. The rooms were adequate in size but the bathroom was tiny. The clothes closets were open with no doors as was the kitchen. The kitchen had chipped worktops, a grubby fridge and units that looked as though they were meant for a garage rather than an executive suite hotel.The room had seen better days and not only needed redecorating but was also not very clean. There were marks on the walls and stains on the carpet made you feel uncomfortable about walking across the room in bare feet.The location was good and the front door staff were excellent. However, if you are looking for an executive suite hotel in New York I suggest you look further than this barely adequate hotel.

<Author>Gatrgrl
<Content>Better Than Expected Thanks, TripAdvisor! I studied reviews of many hotels in New York, choosing the Affinia Colletion because it offered suites. Our family of 8 adults, which included an 84 year-old aunt  90 year-old mother, needed room for two wheelchairs,  lots of luggage. We chose a 1 bedroom  2 bedroom suite. Fabulous 2 bedroom suite on the 17th floor - more floor space than imagined, with big bedrooms, great kitchen  lounging area, all clean  tastefully decorated. In the midst of the heat wave, we could not wait to get back to our room for the comfort. Great staff - always cheerful  helpful, particularly in procuring cabs. Responded quickly to requests for extra anything. Pleasant to have the kitchen facilities, as we ate our breakfasts  several dinners in our suite. Not difficult to walk to Times Square, UN, Grand Central Terminal, Empire State Bldg, St. Patrick's Cathedral,  Central Park (south entrance). Lots of restaurants within walking distance. Affinia 50 advertises as a business hotel, but it served our family superbly. We will use this hotel again.
