<Author>PaulaRuth
<Content>Great Hotel - Location Eh It is so hard to find a good hotel in NYC, when you're going in blind. My brother picked this hotel, he and his wife stayed in one room, my mom and I stayed in another. NYC hotel rooms are notoriously small, these were very generous, could easily have accommodated 2 more people and still not gotten in each other's way, Full bathroom, lots of room to put your toiletries down. You can request your choice of type of pillow! Good front desk, attractive lobby. Not happy that you had to pay like $8 for 15 minutes of computer time but maybe this is normal in the city? Only complaint but for me was a big one, was the location. It was a 20 minute walk to attractions, and had to cab it more than I would have liked. Aside from that, I would have stayed here again, when I visited the next month.

<Author>tim/marg
<Content>What a great place to stay. My wife and I stayed from July 1 to 5 and this hotel lived up to all our expectations and more. We arrived very late on Saturday night and were gives a large suite on the 8th floor....great room but I had asked for a view when making the booking and there was none. Next morning I approached Roy at reception and he was really nice about it. He said he would try to sort it out later that day when the rooms were vacated but then as soon as I got back to our room he rang and said that the bellboy was on his way to collect out things to take them to the penthouse....270 degree views from 3 balconies on the 22nd floor at no extra charge. Wow! All the staff at the hotel were equally friendly and helpful and did not always have their hands out for tips....The doormen are great and always had a few words with us as we passed them in the lobby or on the street outside the hotel. There are free drinks and cheese every week night from 6.00 to 7.00 on the 2nd floor which was unexpected and greatly appreciated as it gave us the chance to meet some of the staff and other guests. There are plenty of good restaurants only steps away but we mostly cooked for ourselves in our well equipped kitchen after buying the ingredients from an excellent supermarket that was only a block away. Times Square and Central Park are within easy walking distance but we bought metro passes so we often used the buses that pass the hotel every 10min to get to shows and boat cruises etc. The doorman organised our $20 each transfer to JFK airport which took the back roads and avoided long delays in the post July 4th traffic on the highway. This was our third visit to NY and our best hotel experience by far.  
<Date>Jul 11, 2006

<Author>KAKH
<Content>Definitely a Repeat! As a business traveler, I visit New York at least a dozen times a year. I have stayed at the Affinia 50 at least five or six times this year. Obviously, I would recommend staying here, as I have returned again and again. The staff is always friendly and helpful. Their trademark Cheers is a bit cheesy, but kind of cute.The rooms are much larger than most, although they do have at least a few rooms that are quite small. They range from extremely large with a kitchen (with a small stove, full fridge, etc.) to very small with a mini fridge inside an end table. The rooms are clean and well furnished with contemporary furuniture and luxurious bed linens. The bathrooms are small, but well appointed with Aveda toiletries. The alarm clocks are a pain to set, although they do honor their wake up calls. Their wine and cheese hour is a nice bonus and a good time to relax with business associates before dinner. A bit of variety would be nice as what is served doesn't change at all.The location is great, walking distance from Grand Central, Times Square, the UN and Park Avenue. The deli a couple of doors down is overpriced and mediocre, but the steakhouse next door next to the Kimberly is excellent. Definitely a great value. Will stay here many more times.  
<Date>Jun 29, 2006

<Author>Atlantamac
<Content>Is it really that good?? It was OK. Everything went pretty smoothly. The check in was efficient. Got a room on the 15th floor. I thought the room was huge, but I was in one of the smaller ones, judging by the evacuation map on the back of the door. Still, by New York standards, let's call it huge. No problem with the street noise.Can't really comment on the location, cause it can be good for some, bad for others. (Cabs are so cheap, who cares where it is.)If this hotel were in any other city, it wouldn't rate so high. However, given the space crunch in Manhattan, I have to give an extra star for the room size.

<Author>robinstown
<Content>Loved the Affinia 50 We just got home from an amazing weekend in the city. The Affinia 50 was a great place to stay. It was a girls weekend away for us and we felt very comfortable in this part of town. We stayed on the 16th floor in a one bedroom suite. I have stayed in quite a few hotels and I have to say that this suite was VERY LARGE. The kitchen with full size fridge was a plus for all of our snacks and drinks. The doormen were so sweet and were GREAT at getting cabs very quickly for us.I do suggest the New York Lunchonette two doors down as well as Wollensky's Grill a block away. It was an amazing steak house with fabulous service and a fun atmosphere.Back to the hotel...we have absolutly no complaints! Just a forwarning, some of the stores security devices will deactivate your room key cards so be prepared to make a few trips back down to the lobby bc you can't get in your room. It wasn't really a hassle and they always gave us new cards very quickly! Also, there is a little grocery shop with toiletries, drinks, snacks, etc. just a few doors down. It was nice to have something so close to grab things that we might have forgotten. I needed advil to soothe my aching arms from carrying way too many shopping bags! This was a great hotel with easy subway access, great rooms and a great staff!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Location, Size and Family Friendly Our first family stay in New York City, with the Affinia 50 as our host went off without a hitch. I started communicating with Tanya the concierge a month in advance and she helped with show tickets, restaurant reservations, tips for activities for kids and quickly answered all of my questions - she was fantastic. The room was enormous by New York standards, I have traveled to New York without my family and had great fear of fitting all four of us in a New York hotel room. This is the spot. Doormen were incredible, it was raining some of the time we were there, and the doorman went 1/2 block out the front door to hail a cab for us - we saw him out there doing the same thing for others staying at the hotel - greated us with a Welcome Back every time we passed through the door. Service was flawless by all staff. This hotel is in a safe, neighborhood - very close to subways which we used with ease. My girls are 7 and 11, they loved the subway - we could easily get everywhere we needed to go! We used the New York related media in the club room, and the girls loved using the single serve gourmet coffee machine (making coffee for Mom)Thanks Affinia, we'll be back!

<Content>Book the Affinia 50 Now! Just returned from nine nights at the Affinia 50 in New York City. My wife and two daughters (11 and 8) had a junior suite. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Scots in New York My husband , two boys and my sons girlfriend have just come back from New York on the 13th June, we stayed at the Affinia 50 for five nights. I must admit at first I found the room quite dingy and dark , but we had travelled a long way, it was raining very heavily and felt how had we come here on holiday. It was our first holiday in 10 years. We were very cold in the room the first night and was unable to get the heating working with the controls , told by the front desk that it was not working but they would send up a heater, worked fine and was warmer in no time, remember really tired so feeling a bit cheesed off. Had the best nights sleep I have ever had in a hotel, the mattress topper on the bed and of course my choice of pillow all added to the great comfort. I am not very good at staying in strange beds usually do not sleep well at all, but this bed was great. The second day a bit brighter all round, mood better, had a great nights sleep, so opinion changed, felt the room was fine, big and plenty of space for all our stuff. I must say the staff especially the doormen were absolutely delightful, very very helpful and so so pleasant all the time. Our room was kept reasonably clean, felt it could have been a bit better but fine. The location of the hotel is brilliant just short walk to 5th Avenue, Central Station, Saks, The NBA shop, Central Park, and Rockaffella Centre. Found our way about in no time, the shopping is fantastic, absolutely no money left now, but who cares!!! all well worth it. The only disappointment is that the hotel has no bar and a nightcap before bed and a chance to mingle with other hotel guests would have been good, but hey, has done our livers the world of good. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and a great big thank you to the wonderful doormen and hope you all have a great holiday like we did, WELL BE BACK , AS ARNI SAYS!!!!  
<Date>Jun 15, 2006

<Author>Flyycat
<Content>Would Stay Here again in a NY Minute! My mother and I just returned from a 4 day trip to NYC! I found Affinia 50 through TripAdvisor, whom I use for all my hotel references. TripAdvisor and it's users did not steer us wrong - Affinia 50 was perfect! Upon arrival around 2:15pm we were told that our room was not ready, the bellman stored our bags while we had a Thai lunch meal. Upon returning we were informed that we had been upgraded to a suite (we reserved a Jr. Suite). The suite was HUGE! I do believe that most Manhattanite's would kill for an apt this size! There were two queen beds, a sitting area, a bathroom (with nice tub and shower) and a kitchen. You could spend all day in the room and not feel cramped. We skipped the breakfast, but tried NY Deli (not impressive). Based on a review on this site, we tried Azure Deli (around the corner on 3rd, in the same building). We were blown away by this deli. The buffet was out of this world. Every food choice was available. The proprietor was soo cute.. I asked him if he was open 24 hours.. he said 25 hours.. one hour extra for you! :)Tonya the concierge, Gloria at the front desk and the doormen (Selwyn, etc) were great. They were extremely helpful with directions and general what to do questions. We did not experience any problems with A/C, heat, hot water.. nothing.. There was a pillow menu on our pillow, but we were happy with the ones we had. I did not see any robes, but in the grand scheme of things.. it didn't matter.MINT, the Indian restaurant across the street was Fabulous! I would definitely stay at Affinia 50 again... in a NY minute!!!  
<Date>Jun 12, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very good, but not 100% Having stayed in NYC several times and having read the online reviews, we were really looking forward to our stay at the Affinia. We had booked one twin and one single room. On arrival we were allocated rooms on the third floor - the twin room (316) being particularly dark with no view (overlooked a balcony which you could not access from the room). This was a shame as I had emailed twice prior to arrival to ask for a high floor room if possible as this was my parent's first trip to NYC and an anniversary gift, so really wanted it to be special. A standard lamp was placed in the room the following day - without us having requested this - we were told that some guests had complained the rooms were dark. The rooms were good, although I had a problem with my safe - this took 36 hrs to resolve - not a huge problem as I used the other room's safe, but would have been a problem if we only had one room. Also the coffee machine was faulty and 316 had probs with their plumbing. I cannot fault housekeeping - they were fantastic - rooms were spotless and towels / toiletries replaced each day. Whilst the staff were friendly, the doormen were rarely at the door on your arrival and we found that the desk staff did not volunteer a greeting unless we did so first. However, in fairness, when they did speak, all staff were extremely friendly, polite and only too willing to assist. My impression prior to travelling was that this hotel, being smaller than alot of the hotels in NYC, prided itself on being that much more personal. Unfortunately, I did not feel this to be the case. I wouldn't be put off staying there again, but I think I would make a point of being more pushy about room location and complain more when things go wrong.  
<Date>Jun 9, 2006

<Author>sue&nan
<Content>Amazing ! We could not get over the size of our 1 bedroom suite. So very nice, comfortable, and CLEAN. My sister and I stayed for 6 nights and we could never have found a better location or neighborhood. We were able to walk to so many places or take a cab and then stroll back. The doormen always greeted us before we got to the door with welcome home and cheers. This hotel was part of our whole amazing time in NYC. 2nd floor club level was so nice to relax in for afternoon coffee or wine  cheese each eveing. Everyone was so friendly and helpful and I do hope to stay here again.ps New York Lunchonette' next door is very good. The California Club sandwich was my favorite.

<Author>travelgrrlnyc
<Content>HUGE rooms! I live in NYC, but needed to stay in a hotel for 1 night. I booked a regular room at the Affinia 50 and the nice guy at the front desk upgraded me to a one room suite. IT WAS HUGE! I wish my NYC apartment was as big. My friend and I tried the wine and cheese hour on the 2nd floor and it was really fun. There were several people (but not overly crowded) and it was a really festive atmosphere. It was a great place to watch tv, work on the laptop, etc.Everyone that works at the hotel is beyond nice. From the doormen, to the front desk to the ladies at the Happy Hour...everyone was lovely! There were great Aveda products in the bath and the linens/bed are terrific. I was in room 1806. It runs the length of the side of the building and had terrace for the entire length with entrances from both the living room and bedroom. It was perfect because it doesn't face the brick wall to the back and doesn't directly face the street for any traffic. The ONLY downside to my stay doesn't directly relate to the hotel. They do offer roomservice, but it is from the restaurant next door. We decided to take advantage of our dining room and order in. The food arrived after about an hour and half. We had 1 napkin for the 2 of us. There was no salt, no pepper, no catsup, no mustard, etc. We called to have it sent up and when he finally returned about 20 mintues later he still didn't bring salt. We were told they were out. Now, the room does have a kitchen, but it isn't stocked with things like salt and pepper. I am always prepared to pay more for roomservice, however, we paid $200 for 2 people. That included a $26 tip and to be told they were out of salt is just unacceptable. But please only take this as a warning for roomservice and don't let it stop you from staying at the hotel. I didn't see their breakfast that they offer, but if it is like the Happy Hour...I'm sure it was nice.My overall experience was fantastic. I will stay at the Affinia 50 again. I will just avoid ordering in. There are plenty of great restaurants in the neighborhood and I will just enjoy one of those places instead.  
<Date>May 30, 2006

<Author>AllisonNNH
<Content>Wayyy exceeded expectations I have to go to NYC about every 3-4 weeks on business. I've often stayed at the Benjamin which is a sister property to the Affinia 50. On this trip, the Benjamin was pricing at $498/night so our corporate travel dept asked me to try out the Affinia 50. A few of my colleagues had stayed there about a year ago and hated it so I was pretty nervous. When I arrived, the staff could not have been more gracious or polite. They recognized me as a past guest of the Benjamin and went out of their way to welcome me to their hotel. It was clear that it had been pretty newly renovated and their pride in their hotel showed. The lobby is small, but lovely. There is a very cool waterfall feature that starts up on the 2nd floor (where there is a gorgeous lounge) and flows to the lobby. My room was very nicely decorated, with excellent work space and a bed that was heavenly (sorry Westin, this bed was better!). They have a pillow menu which is awesome if you are a picky pillow person. The room is a typical NYC size - not huge, but not tiny either. The bathroom was nicely appointed, with Aveda amenities and plenty of hot water. When I was given the room assignment, I was concerned bc I was on the 3rd floor, but I never heard a bit of street noise - until I opened the window. My only ding on the hotel was that the HVAC system was not working correctly, and by night time, my room was hot and the AC had not yet been turned on - that's when I discovered the windows could open! I am a very picky, very frequent traveler, and I highly recommend this hotel.  
<Date>Apr 24, 2006

<Author>mholbrook
<Content>Great time April 3 - 9th, 2006 in NYC  Our husbands weren't interested in spring break travel, so a coworker friend and I recently planned our very first trip ever to NYC. We chose the Affinia 50 based almost solely on the Trip Advisor reviews -- and we weren't the least bit disappointed.Our room was #1603, a jr. suite with a small balcony, corner suite so we had windows on two sides. My coworker brought along her 11 YO son and the 3 of us had plenty of room in our suite -- two queen beds, one for each adults and a pull-out sofa queen bed for my coworker's son.The kitchenette is very handy-- we liked being able to keep cold drinks and bottled water on hand (available at the corner deli). There is a toaster, microwave, and small range as well -- The wine  cheese on the 2nd floor Mon-Thurs was a treat -- 6-7 PM only -- we first arrived on Tuesday about 6:45 PM and upon check-in asked if we could grab a glass of wine to take to our room -- the front desk clerk said Of Course! but when we stopped off on the 2nd floor, the attendant there would not allow us to do so... Not sure why we were refused... he seemed a little flustered that we even asked so we just headed on upstairs wine-less.The door attendants are attentive and friendly, as are the front desk and housekeeping staff.Tonya the concierge cheerfully and expertly obtained a last minute ticket for the Saturday matinee of Wicked -- a little pricey at $200 (though much less than the box-office premium price of $340+ for a last-minute single seat) -- and since I likely won't be traveling back to NYC any time soon, for me, it was worth every dime -- fabulous fabulous fabulous production.We also asked Tonya for a recommendation for a good close-by Italian restaurant -- she recommended Ribot's just a block or two away -- not impressed -- overly priced, and not a 'traditional' Italian menu -- I ordered the lasagna thinking it would be... well... lasagna. It had lasagna noodles, but was filled with cream sauce (which I don't much care for) and string beans and potato chunks. No protein (like chicken or whatever) and no marinara sauce (which is what I expected) anywhere in sight. My friend ordered the lobster salad for $21.00 -- and within a short time spent the rest of the night in the bathroom and all day the next day in bed from apparent food poisoning. (I'm writing this review from the hotel -- she's still hunkered down in bed and I'm hoping we can get her well enough to put her on the plane home in the morning.Trying to think of anything really negative about the Affinia50 has been tough -- We had plenty of hot water for the 3 of us -- the temperature in the room is a little tough to control for individual tastes -- and you may find yourself waiting on an elevator during busy times as we did -- but usually not for long. Street noise -- yes, some -- but hey -- it's NEW YORK CITY! We managed to sleep right through it...Overall -- the Affinia 50 more than met our expectations. Neither of us however had any other experience in NYC to compare it to -- it is nicely located as others have pointed out. We used the subway from time to time, but our feet to walk just about everywhere...Our first 3 days were incredible -- we do recommend skipping the trip to the top of the Empire State Building - what a racket -- it was very overcast the day we went, which was fine -- but we paid $16.00 to go to the top... they practically force-fed another Omni-type movie presentation for an additional fee, which we turned down and they seemed a little annoyed that we didn't want to do it. Judging by the empty rows of disneyland-type roping for people to traverse through, we were there on a very slow day -- it still took us nearly an hour to get to the single elevator -- where they shuttle us sardine-cram-packed to floor 82 where they make you get off and you are MANDATED to have your picture taken for purchase later -- then you get back in line to get back on the elevator to go to the top -- there you are shoved out into the gift shop -- and though on a nice day, it would have been pleasant once you got up there and outside, it was windy and cold and we barely stayed outside for 2 or 3 minutes... then went back down where we were AGAIN forced to go the 82nd floor route to LOOK at the photos we were forced to pose for and tell them we didn't want them, only to get back in line AGAIN to get the final ride to the bottom. Skip this nonsense and go to the Rockefeller Top of the Rock instead -- if you go there in the evening hours, it is much less crowded and we had a great experience with a clear night and a beautiful view.Liberty/Ellis Island were terrific. We also saw Al Roker up close at the Today show set, and also went skating at Rockefeller plaza. We had fun walking all over Times Square and Battery Park -- South Seaport's exhibit The Body is quite interesting if you like that sort of stuff (we did)...Everything in NYC is is pretty spendy so bring lots of $$$...Final word on the Affinia 50 -- compared to other hotels we've been in throughout various locations in the U.S., we all 3 voted that we would recommend the Affinia 50 to other travelers without hesitation. Have fun in the Big Apple! (Except for the food-poisoning incident) we sure did!  
<Date>Apr 8, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>O.K. By NYC Standards............h Stayed here for 4 nights, reserved a Jr. Suite. Room requests were not honored. The hotel was o.k., not as good as expected.1)Checked in late morning. My room was not ready, come back at 2:00 (I had requested a room away from the elevator, or with a view). When I returned, and again noted my preferences, the only rooms available in the Jr. Suite category that met my requests were without two queen beds (I was told most of the Jr. Suites are in the back, along the alley). We were eventually placed in a lower room floor (6), no view (on the back alley, albeit quiet), next to the elevator (ding, ding).2) And, speaking of the elevator, only one (of 2 to the floors above 5) was broken on Saturday, fixed on Sunday. We could at least walk the six flights to our room.3) The rooms. They are large, and nicely decorated. The beds were comfortable, the housekeeping staff helpful (the gas stove didn't appear to be working properly, maintenance arrived with 10 minutes). The kitchen is a great advantage if you don't want to drop $$$ eating 3 meals in restaurants.4) The doormen were friendly, helpful, and as cheerful as you will find within the hotel staff.4) The lounge was very nice. With the exception of the pleasant wine reception, M-Th for one hour, and the a.m. breakfast, it was deserted. 5) Location was good, walking distance to Grand Central, Rock Center, Times Square (a bit of a hike) and the subway.6) Prior to departing to the airport, I requested assistance in getting my airline boarding pass printed out. Was told by desk staff that I needed to use their business center (at $8 per 15 minutes) to do this. The concierge was not on duty until noon. At last, I asked one of the managers passing through the lobby, who agreed to help. Success!Overall, maintenance, housekeeping, room quality good. Doormen, great. Front office/desk staff, need work.  
<Date>Mar 29, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A wonderful hotel This hotel could not have been better. The staff were so friendly and helpful, the rooms were huge!! and the beds were divine. I really could not fault it. I stayed there with my father and daughter and would go back tomorrow if I could! There was even a CD player in each room with a jazz/blues CD to remind you that you were in the Big Apple. Plenty of great pubs in the area - try JD's round the corner for superb food and a really friendly atmosphere. Avoid Mama Mexican - they really rip you off with the service charge and the atmosphere is quite intimidating if you don't order lots of drinks!

<Author>Tora2006
<Content>Wonderful hotel, Superb location, Great staff Having just returned from our first trip to New York, we felt we had to praise the Affinia 50 hotel. The hotel's location was first-class, with a good selection of restaurants close-by (try the Mexican on 2nd Ave - Zarella'a; and the diner a few doors up for a great breakfast). The room we were given was spacious, clean and well-appointed. The bed was sooooo comfortable! The staff in the hotel couldn't do enough for you - but weren't 'over the top', just friendly and helpful.The subway was only a block away, and is an efficient system that gets you all around New York. For a great place for drinks, try the quirky Monkey bar at the Hotel Elysee (about 10 mins from the Affinia 50) or for a treat, the bar on the 23rd floor of The Peninsula Hotel - great views of the city! Thanks to the Affinia 50 for making our first trip to New York so enjoyable!!

<Author>hobbes2172
<Content>Affinia 50 - Great Location, Great Staff The location was excellent in Midtown East. It is only a few blocks walk to the UN, Times Square, Grand Central, and the NY Public Library. My room faced the street and was therefore a little noisier, but I enjoyed it. The kitchenette was small, but good for my purposes (coffee in the AM and putting leftovers in the fridge). The breakfast was convenient, but overpriced. Lots of great restaurants nearby - a fantastic Turkish place and a really funky Indian restaurant. Good shopping nearby, as well. Perks:Pillow service - choose from a selection of pillow types and styles. Aveda products in the bathroom! Two Internet stations available until 11:00 PM.Gym - I didn't use it.Excellent, safe location.Spotted some celebrities in the neighbourhood. The staff were very nice. I had a stain on my shirt and asked the staff to leave me some cleaning liquid, which they did. They were very polite and friendly.Definitely would recommend it and would stay there again.

<Author>kbankatt
<Content>Wonderfully accomodating Six friends and I booked two rooms on-line (a one bedroom suite and a jr. suite)for one Saturday night. (We were in town to see a play) We requested adjoining/connecting rooms. When we arrived at the hotel we discovered that the rooms were on different floors. The manager, who was very friendly and accomodating arranged for 2 one bedroom suites that were right next to one another in a corner on the 20th floor. It felt like we had the entire floor to ourselves. Wow! The rooms were great. They were very spacious and comfortable. Even the roll-away bed was comfy. The kitchen was very adequate for its purpose. We had a lot of snacks and drinks. There was plenty of room for all of our food. And they had clean glasses, plates and cups in cupboards. The concierge recommended two marvelous spots for Sunday brunch. She called to make reservations for us and when we arrived at the restaurant the following afternoon we had an excellent table. We checked out of the hotel Sunday afternoon and were able to leave our 16 or so pieces of luggage in the hotel while we attended the theatre. We picked up our bags, drove to Long Island and realized that two bags were missing and we had left a cell phone charger in the room. The bellman brought the bags and cell phone charger to us in Long Island!!! The service at this hotel is exceptional - enough said. Cheers.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great location, OK hotel The location of this hotel is great. The hotel room was average. I guess you get what you pay for in this case! The room rate was very reasonable. Our room was located in front of the elevator and our window faced the street, VERY NOISY! After the first night, I requested a room change but was told that the hotel was sold out and a room change was not an option. When making a reservation, you may want to request a room away from the elevator.The temperature of the room was also a problem. During the winter months, the AC does not work. The room was very stuffy. We had to get someone from the front desk to open the window in our room to get air circulating. The room is small so I guess that is why it was so stuffy. By the way, the bathroom is big enough for one person at a time. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. Don't expect luxury at all, but for the price you pay I guess it is average. It was also nice that they supply Aveda products in the bathroom.When we were checking out, I voiced my opinion to the front desk clerk. She did give me a voucher for a room upgrade if we decide to stay there again in the future.  
<Date>Mar 16, 2006

<Author>catador
<Content>Good Value. We recently spent three days at the Affinia 50, after finding a rate of $177 for a standard room, through the internet.We travel to NYC a couple times per year, and lived in the city many years ago.We found the Affinia 50 to be a reasonably good value for the money. The hotel is pleasant, clean, with good natured staff, and a terrific location in East Midtown. It is an easy and safe walk to Times Square, to Rockefeller Center, the 5th Ave. corridor, the Theater District, and the Modern Arts Museum. There are several ATMs within a block from the hotel, as well as a farmacy, and one of those wonderful delis with a huge salad and hot food bars. Breakfast at the hotel is overpriced, but OK if you want to save time or avoid walking. There is a Starbucks and a Au Bon Pain within a two block radius.The rooms are spacious, seem to have been recently renovated, with comfortable beds and pillows, and nicely appointed bathrooms with Aveda toiletries.Although we were in a standard room, there was a small kitchen counter, sink, refrigerator and microwave oven. Complimentary coffee is supplied.We asked for a room facing the back, which was very quiet, despite being next to the elevators, on the 19th floor. Housekeeping and maintenance (the toilet was clogged when we arrived) is courteous and efficient.We were quoted a parking rate of $34 over the phone, but on arrival were told our vehicle was too large (A Honda CR-V!), and would have to pay $44 per day. I found parking around the corner on 51st St. for $39.Our only complaints were the (old) slow elevators, one of which seemed to be frequently out of order, and room thermostats which don't seem to work (the windows can be opened).In all, The Affinia 50 is a logically priced three star hotel, that we will surely return to, in future trips.  
<Date>Mar 8, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Nice room for the price The Affinia 50 was a fine hotel and very comfortable, especially for the price. Just got back from a two night weekend getaway with my husband. We had a junior suite, which was a v large room with a kitchenette. Bathroom was a little small. The location is good if you're looking for something midtown - close to the subway line and walking distance to midtown sights. Staff was excellent. That said, sometimes I just prefer a hotel with a little more character - even if it costs a little more. The affinia 50 was functional but not charming. I might stay here again if the price is as good as the deal we got this weekend.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best Secret in New York This hotel gets the A+ award for cleanliness, interesting art/decor, great use of space and friendly and sincerely caring staff. I have been staying at this hotel since I moved to Boston from NY several years ago. Whether for a quick business trip or a fun getaway weekend in the City, my first choice is always Affinia 50. You can't beat the location for going uptown, downtown or crosstown for theatre. When they've been sold out, I have tried others like the Hilton and a few boutique hotels. None measure up.It's hard to find this type of service, wonderful space and great attention to security in a NY hotel. There always seem to be trade offs but not here! I highly recommend you give it a try on your next trip into the City.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great for families We went (family of four) during the Thanksgiving holiday. I was a little skeptical staying in a hotel I did not recognize (ie Hyatt, Marriott, etc), but I was looking for something bigger than the standard hotel room. It was fabulous! First off though because I asked for an upper floor with a balcony we received a rather smallish room with a HUGE balcony. Great for summer, not great for November. So the next day they accomodated us and gave us a non-balcony room. It was the largest hotel room I've ever stayed in - easily 600 sq. feet. The living area/dining area (with sofa bed)was large, the bedroom (with two double beds) was a standard hotel room size. The bathroom modern but small. The kitchen had everything in a small space, but enough room to cook.I would recommend this place especially for families. Plenty of room to spread out for the cost of a typical hotel room in New York. O'neils a few doors down has great food too.

<Author>SoccerFolks
<Content>Wonderfully comfortable hotel My husband and I booked a single queen-bed room (for $169) at the Affinia 50 for one night based on the TripAdvisor reviews. We were able to check in early (just after noon) and received a free upgrade to a one bedroom suite. (We don't know why because the hotel was sold out for the night.) Everything was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. We were on the sixth floor and had a great view of the Blizzard of 2006! We only stayed one night but would have been very comfortable staying longer. The hotel is just a couple of blocks east of St. Patrick's Cathedral and Rockefellar Center. We passed up the cold breakfast buffet ($15) on the second floor in favor of O'Neil's hot breakfast buffet ($12) two doors down. I highly recommend O'Neil's - the buffet was great - they made omelets to order and there was plenty of fresh fruit and baked goods. The buffet included coffee and orange juice. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. They also let us have a one hour late check out. The only down side was that we attended three shows while we were in NYC and we were on the east side of 5th avenue rather than the west side (where the theaters are) - although its much quieter on the east side.  
<Date>Feb 14, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The best I checked in around 3:30-4:00 pm on Saturday. To begin, I drove into the city fearing that I would have no where to park my car, but as soon as I arrived the young man in front of the hotel helped me with my bags and assured me that my car would be parked in a safe place. Needless to say this was a weight off my shoulders. Next, the young woman at the reception desk was absolutely the most professional and courteous person I have seen in a while. She was great. Furthermore, the hotel looked amazing and the rooms were spacious and extremely comfortable. The next day we woke to find the city covered in snow. Within a few minutes of requesting my car it was in front of the hotel waiting. My girlfriend and I are both in college and graduating this May and on my budget, this was a great value for excellent service from the moment we walked in the door to the moment we left. I have already recommended this hotel to a few of my friends who are looking to do something nice for their girlfriends and will continue to recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in a hotel in the city. Job well done!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Place to Stay This hotel has it all!! From the time we arrived until the time we left, it was a wonderful experience. The staff is very friendly and quick to meet any of your needs. The rooms are outstanding as far as the size goes. We had a junior suite for three of us, which included a full kitchen area, a couch and chairs for relaxing. The beds were so luxurious, with a special pillow menu, which we indulged in. The location was great, easy walking distance to most attractions. We felt very safe in this area at night(3 women). It is also right by the subway line, which is very convenient(direct line to Canal Street) if cabs are not readily available. The only downfall is getting a cab if it's raining, because the two hotels down the street get the cabs first (one way street). We had to walk across to the Waldorf for a cab which still took some time. We would definitely stay here again. It's a lot quieter than Times Square.  
<Date>Feb 4, 2006

<Author>VM75
<Content>Excellent Service, Great Location We visited the Plaza 50 (as it was known then) in April 2004, and were pleasantly surprised. The twin rooms had lovely king size double beds, a compact but nice size bathroom, and everything seemed clean and well kept. Service was excellent, you just cannot fault the staff at this hotel from the doorman with his little jaunty hat, to the reception staff. I would be careful about which room you get though - I had a twin room to myself, but my window faced a huge wall which was just beneath the main buildings fan... so it could seem quite noisy at night! But thats no real criticism, as for us we just wanted to sleep and wash up at the hotel so we could explore NY city, not live there! My tip - don't bother with room service for food. There is an excellent diner next door for breakfasts, lunches, and even 1am snacks! The hotel get all of their food from there, and pass on the surcharge to you, so why not just get up out of your bed and save yourself a few 'bucks' by simply going to the diner and eating there? Otherwise, this is a brilliant place. When we stayed, it ranked about 70th on the tripadvisor list - and now its number 2! I'm not surprised. Everything is within walking distance, its a nice part of town away from the tourist crowds, and I would happily stay there again in the future.  
<Date>Feb 1, 2006

<Author>hoppapoppa
<Content>a Tripadvisor rec. pays off again! We stayed 2 nights at the Affinia 50, having booked it because it was the cheapest well-reviewed hotel on Tripadvisor (we paid about $160 a night for a regular guest room in late January). The bed was one of the most comfortable I've encountered--in a hotel or anywhere--with really wonderful bedclothes. The room was quite large by NYC standards, with plenty of room to work away from the bed. Great bathroom, too.As mentioned, there's no restaurant, and we didn't go to the (rather expensive) buffet breakfast, but there's a great bagel store just around the corner on 3rd Ave. The nicest surprise at the Affinia was the staff, who were friendly  helpful without exception, no matter the hour.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Huge, Clean, Modern Rooms at the Affinia 50 Went to The City for Christmas. This hotel was probably the nicest surprise of our trip! I picked it largely based on these reviews. Our room was HUGE w/ a full kitchenette, big very comfortable king-sized bed, choice of pillow types, couch, large work desk, lots of storage and closet space, full-view mirror, Aveeda bath products, 5 large windows overlooking 51st street office, polite staff. Everyone kept warning me how rooms described as large in NYC are usually average-sized at best compared to other locations-- not this place!! They were also very clean and very modern. Outside noise could be heard but was minimal. Location is great!, 2 blocks from 5th Avenue, minutes from Rockefeller Center. We got a great rate, less than $200 a night. Don't let the small (yet clean, not cramped, modern) lobby fool you (you can walk through several $400+-a-night more grand hotel lobbies nearby for free!). The whole second floor is a guest lounge (not a bar kind), much like the airline club ones. No restaurant didn't bother us, plenty of dining and a full grocery right around the corner w/o crossing a street. Can you tell that we will go back?  
<Date>Jan 23, 2006

<Author>Bostontrvler
<Content>Good hotel, good price, good location. After much research, we stayed at the Affinia from Tues. to Thurs. The price was decent for what we got. <Author>leisurefun
<Content>Awesome Affinia! We just returned from a quick trip to NYC and chose the Affinia based upon tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. The staff knocks themselves out to be helpful. Tanya, the concierge made great recommendations and reservations for brunch and dinner. She even sent us complimentary champagne at dinner for our special occasion. The bellhops were very friendly and the valet parking worked out well. Our room was a great deal thanks to their Sunday in the City package. The one bedroom suite was very spacious and nice. If you wanted to cook in for a longer stay they provide stove, fridge and dishwasher. Perfect for families. The bed was quite comfortable. I was a little disappointed in the pillow menu. Only 3 to choose from and we each chose one. None of them were as nice as what was on the bed. The hotel is in a great location and it is very quiet. Ess a bagel is great for NY bagels. We'll definitely return. Enjoy!

<Author>Melphila
<Content>Good, not excellent My two teenagers and I stayed at the Affinia 50 from Jan. 14 - 16. <Author>ashleym
<Content>What a Deal! I was on a budget, which is really restraining when visiting NYC. I found this hotel randomly and got a guest room with king bed for $150. I am extremely picky, a nice clean bathroom is a must and the bed should look sleep-friendly. And I was extremely impressed with the Affinia. They have downcomfortors on beds with down pillows and a feather bed. The bathroom was very spacious and clean. Since I didn't book a suite I was concerned that we were going to have a tight room. It was actually fairly spacious for two people. If you are into the bar scene, a few quant bars are right around the corner on 2nd. This is less than a 10 minute walk to Rockafeller Center. I would definitly stay here again. My recommendation is if you are driving, leave early and stay late. The Affinia holds your luggage and parks your car for you so you can get the most out of your trip without being inconvienced. I also recommend the Bryant Park Grill for brunch or dinner, its located right in Time Square in Bryant Park. Also they have cheaper ice skating there than at Rockafeller. ENJOY YOUR STAY!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>We'll Definitely Be Back I travel fairly often to NYC on business and stay at W Hotels, most recently the W New York. We're traveling to New York with our sons, 15 and 19, in May for our daughter's graduation, and we were hoping not to pay what we're accustomed to paying on my expense account for a room/suite that can accommodate us all. I did some checking around and found great reviews for the Affinia 50. We had to be near NY this week and opted to spend our last night in Manhattan to check out this hotel. My husband was circumspect, having developed a taste for the W, and was genuinely amazed. We had a one-bedroom suite on the 21st floor for $299. The room was beyond spacious, comfortable, the bed was wonderful. We ordered room service, which was delivered from the Kimberly Hotel next door. They initially brought 1 hamburger, not 2, but they were so gracious about the mix-up that I don't consider that a misstep. Chances are things aren't always going to go perfect, and the test of great service is the response whe I know it's in a great location and there are plenty of decent restaurants on 2nd Ave. We'll definitely be back in May with the family, and I intend to stay here instead of the W when I return on business.  
<Date>Jan 13, 2006

<Author>emmajane7
<Content>We shall return We spent three nights here, largely on Tripadvisor's recommendation, and we were quite impressed. Our room was the least expensive--no suite, no kitchen--but it was a fine size for us. Bathroom small but comfortable enough; loved the shower. Also loved the buckwheat pillows on the pillow menu. Even though we were only on the 4th floor, the street noise was minimal.And the staff--everyone was so helpful and welcoming! The doormen were great, the maids smiled, and the desk staff were efficient and pleasant. All in all, we'll be back...soon!

<Author>expat4ever
<Content>SHHHH!!!!! What a GREAT FIND!!!! My kids and I stayed in a Junior Suite with a balcony overlooking the city. The room was very spacious, bright and cheerful. The location of the hotel was great -- we walked everywhere (Rockerfeller Ctr, Times Square, Central Park). There are lots of little restaurants around the hotel (Do a google search of menu pages new york city and get on the website to do a search of restaurants in the East 50's area. The bagel shop, Ess-a-bagel, about a block away from the hotel has fantastic bagels so we went there every morning for breakfast. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. I could not find a hairdryer in my room and the staff brought a new dryer within 5 minutes. The room was very clean, the kitchen even had an oven, and the shower was great. I would definitely stay here again.I almost didn't want to write this review because I don't want the hotel to become so popular that they start raising their prices. so sshhhh... keep this to yourself.

<Author>Newtonian2
<Content>Many extras, fine service My wife and I spent an enjoyable weekend at the Affinia 50, one of the better New York hotels we've found in its price range ($159). Our initial room in the hotel was average size for New York hotels -- smaller than rooms in most cities, but then no one goes to New York to sit in a hotel room. Unfortunately, it also had a heater that could not be turned down, but the staff promptly upgraded us to one of their massive suites (which included a small kitchen and large sitting area). This is more room than we needed.Since most visitors probably won't have this sort of luck, it's worth mentioning that, even with a smaller room, this would have been a very pleasant place to stay. The location is excellent: close to the east side shops and restaurants, but only a (brisk) 20 minute walk over to the Broadway theaters. It has a well-equipped fitness center (2 eliptical machines, 2 treadmills, a stairmaster, some bikes, and various weight machines) that is open 24 hours a day. There is no lobby on the first floor, but the second floor has two large sitting rooms, with books, big screen TVs, books, and a gas fireplace -- a very nice place to sit and read the newspaper before setting out. There's also a small room with computers (though the price for internet access is a bit steep).My wife tried the buckwheat pillow and liked it quite a bit. The staff was quite helpful. In addition to the upgrade, the manager bailed us out when we somehow managed to enter a combination into the closet safe that neither of us could remember (I'd always wondered what would happen if you did this), and a broken bed lamp was repaired, without our mentioning it, by housekeeping. The hotel also makes various packets of maps and guidebooks available for those interested in shopping or in museums, while runners can get packet which includes a pedometer along with the maps. Internet connections are available in the rooms and, helpfully enough, there was an ethernet cable in the desk drawer.I had only one very minor complaint: though there are coffee makers in the rooms (always a welcome feature) and while there is a pod coffeemachine available on the second floor except when breakfast was served, the only way to get coffee during breakfast (which will set you back $15 -- we opted for a coffeeshop down the street) is to pay $3.50 a mug. But with Starbucks infesting the neighborhood, this wasn't a major problem.We'd certainly stay here again.  
<Date>Jan 8, 2006

<Author>AWD
<Content>Pet Friendly My husband and I decided at the last minute to go to NYC for 5 days over XMAS. We were in search for a pet friendly hotel and one with reasonable rates. Affinia 50 offered both. The TripAdvisor reviews helped with our decision as well. We were so glad we made the choice! We had a fantastic stay. Our Jr. Suite was incredibly spacious for NYC standards. The kitchen was an added bonus. The bed was very comfortable (slept like a baby which is rare when we stay in hotels), the comforter and pillows were great as well. The furnishings were stylish and modern. Aveda toiletries were a nice touch in the bathroom. The staff were geniunely friendly and very professional (a rarity these days). They all greeted our dog by name everytime we went thru the lobby and always showered her with attention. They obviously love animals which is cool in my book. The location is outstanding....close to so many things (Central Park, 5th Ave and Madison Ave shopping, Rockefeller, St. Patricks, easy walk to Times Square, subway, etc). The only negatives would be the air temperature in room...it seemed that our thermostat wasn't working correctly. We called to have it looked at, but no one ever came to fix it. So we had the windows open the entire time for relief from the heat (the brisk 40 degree temps outside helped cool us down). The elevators were extremely slow...we waited numerous times for over 5 minutes and at times took the stairs (we were on the 7th floor). I highly recommend Affinia 50....we will definitely stay there again in the future.  
<Date>Dec 28, 2005

<Author>ktt217
<Content>Definitely recommend the Affinia 50! My sister and I stayed at the Affinia 50 the weekend before Christmas. We are both frequent visitors to the city and have experienced accommodations ranging from friends' apartments to numerous hotels. We are also extremely picky, particularly about cleanliness and bedding. We found both the cleanliness and the bedding to be excellent at this hotel. The bed was very comfortable. The pillow menu is always a nice touch. They did a nice job renovating this building. Our room looked modern. The bathroom was on the small side (especially for a junior suite) but this is to be expected in an older building. However, the one thing that stood out the most was the service. Upon arrival, we were actually given a choice - a quiet suite with a balcony on the 16th floor facing the back or one with a great view facing the city but no balcony. We chose the balcony. When we got up to the room, we decided that it was too quiet for a trip to NYC and would rather face the city. The staff was understanding and promptly changed our room. However, the new keys did not work in the new room. We had to go back to the check-in desk. The desk attendant was very apologetic and sent us a bottle of wine for the key mix-up even though we felt at fault for changing our minds about the room! He even called to make sure the room was to our satisfaction.Another testament to the service provided: My sister is allergic to fragrant shampoos and soaps. However, she forgot to pack her own. The front desk provided us with a list of nearby stores that carry the shampoo she needed. In addition, a housekeeper searched the supply closet for shampoo. She wasn't even the housekeeper for our floor!If we had to find a negative about this hotel, it would be the concierge. We inquired about reservations at a particular restaurant. She stated that our restaurant of choice was very new and popular and that it would be impossible to get a reservation. She said she would try to call later in the day when the restaurant opened. I even had to provide her with the phone number to the restaurant! We ended up calling the restaurant ourselves and got a reservation at the time we wanted. Even though we did not find her very helpful, she did appear to be very helpful with another guest regarding shows.Overall, we loved the hotel and had a great time! We had theater tickets we could not use and ended up leaving them for a front desk attendant in appreciation of good service.  
<Date>Dec 28, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Comfortable Beds, Great Service, Excellent Location! The Affinia 50 is an excellent choice! We stayed for 6 nights and felt like we were coming home after each day of sightseeing. The staff was great and very friendly. They even offered guests cups of fruit punch at the front desk. Ask for the map that is torn from a pad - it's very readable and has subway info. The New York Luncheonette down the street has good food and very reasonably priced. A good sushi restaurant is also nearby.We always had a good nights sleep because of the comfortable beds and down comforters. The room was clean and decorated beautifully. The only thing was the bathroom was tiny! This was probably because there was a small kitchen in the room, too. The best thing is that the Affinia 50 is pretty central. Rockefeller Center, Times Square, 5th Ave. shops, and Museum of Modern Art is within walking distance. The subway is only a block away.We highly recommend the Affinia 50!  
<Date>Dec 27, 2005

<Author>Shakespeare_fan
<Content>Good, but not great We stayed in a room on the 5th floor -- they have a separate elevator shaft that goes only to the lower floors -- this was an added convenience. The trade off is no view -- the room looked out over A/C equipment in a neigboring building. The room was average size for a NY hotel -- way smaller than at the sister Affinia Dumont on 34th St. They had a pillow menu -- we chose to augment the standard foam pillows with buckwheat pillows. They were great -- I would recommend them -- a very nice feature. There were 3 complaints:* too many mirrors. The bedroom area was dominated by a giant full length mirror in a large wooden frame. Perhaps they thought it would make the room look bigger. The closet door was also a full length mirror. There was another round mirror above the work desk. The bathroom door had another full length mirror. There were 2 more mirrors inside the bathroom (one with magnification features). The room had a total of 3 full length and 3 smaller mirrors. Way too many for such a small space.* noisy toilet. When the toilet flushes it sounds like an explosion has occurred. Luckily the room is well insulated -- we did not hear any other toilets flushing in adjoining rooms.* retrieving luggage left earlier in the day. This took about 20 minutes -- the lobby was not very crowded -- they seemed to have few staff on hand at this time. This delay caused us to miss a connection on leaving NY. Not a great memory to have on the way out of this hotel. Affinia Dumont remains my choice as a better hotel in the same price range.  
<Date>Dec 27, 2005

<Author>RUGRAD
<Content>Post Marathon...Hotel in Midtown not downtown We stayed at the Affina after the marathon, contrary to to other review the hotel is a midtown hotel, not downtown...50th street is a good spot for the marathon especially if you are flying out the next day as hotel is on East Side of Manhattan closer to Laguardia and JFK. Hotel is relatively less expensive versus other hotels...but it is still expensive $400/night was what we ended paying all in.We had a jr suite with kitchen which is a nice touch if you are staying more than one night. The restuarants on the block are good there is a steak place a few doors down and a Diner as well. I think Smith  Wollensky is nearby as well.The problems revolved around the room and service, when we came in there were two lights out, condsidering the room has 3 lights that was a problem...also the video games did not work which is a problem if you have young children. In terms of service on arrival while I was running my wife had to wait a long, long time to check in everyone was busy doing nothing while she waited and asked repeatedly for help, finally we ordered room service to be delivered at 6 AM b/c we were leaving for flight at 9AM...when we ordered the night before we were advised no problem it will be there between 6 and 6:15....needless to say we were on the phone in the morning where they said they couldn't get it to us until 7:30AM at earliest...we had ordered oatmeal and eggs nothing fancy...Diner down the street came in handy. I would not stay at the hotel again there are many other boutique hotels that I would spend my money at...The Benjamin a little further down for instance...  
<Date>Dec 24, 2005

<Author>snoopy1
<Content>Great, Great, Great! Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Affinia 50 at it was excellent. In a great location which was close to bloomingdales, grand central station, 5th avenue shops, top of the rock and times square, just about everywhere was walkable from this area. After having a problem with our room booking when we arrived ( our booking agents fault not affinia's) they assured us that they would get us the appropriate room the following day. The suite was fantastic, had a small kitchen but had everything you needed. The bathroom was spacious and the shower was fantastic. We had a sleeping/lounge area which was extremely comfortable. While we were in NYC the transit strike was on and the hotel kept us informed of what was happening, even organising car-pooling to get guests to the airports. They printed letters and gave them to guests explaining that they may be understaffed due to workers being unable to get transport, however we never found this to be the case and after a long days shopping our room was always made up for us to come back to. They even cleaned our dishes! I found the staff attitude to be very friendly and customer orientated. The service was also very personal, something i like in a hotel. Especially in such a difficult time for the staff with the strike.  The recpetion was very helpful in recommending restaurants and Azure and the New York Lunchonette were great for breakfast. The hotel doesnt have a restaurant but this wasnt a problem due to the vast number of good quality (some high priced, others not so, so look around)restuarants in the area. The bed is one of the most comfortable around and there is also a pillow menu which was a nice touch.  Room service is also available with the restaurant next door providing the catering, however we did not use this service. The hotel provided us with a late check out since our flight out wasnt til late and we used the club room to relax in before catching a cab. The club room provided cheese and wine between 6pm and 7pm monday to friday and serves a continental breakfast buffet for around $15 everyday if you decide you're too tired to walk round the corner for breakfast. The Affinia 50 was a fantastic hotel for our first (and definately not last!) visit to a very busy NYC. It was a relaxing haven to rest after a day of sightseeing and shopping. I can highly recommend it and we will definately be back!  
<Date>Dec 23, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Hotel + Staff + Location = We'll Be Back My wife  daughter (21) had never been to the City, so I wanted their first trip to be outstanding. I can't imagine picking a better property than Affinia 50. Here goes: POSITIVES: Staff is very friendly, helpful and courteous. My wife had a minor medical problem and the hotel immediately contacted their oncall physician who immediately called our room, made a referal to another DR. who called and took care of the problem. Folks, it doesn't get any better than that! The decor is modern but not sterile.My daugher, majoring in interior design, was mightly impressed. We stayed in room 1011 which was well decorated, enormous (20'X30'), and pretty quite. The room also has a small kitchen that was useful. The maid service was perfect and our one room service meal was ontime and exactly as we had ordered. NOTE* This hotel doesn't have a restaurant or bar, but there is an excellent restauran/bar next door (George's). This hotel is only 2 blocks from Rockefeller center  about 4-5 blocks from Madison/Fifth Ave. The hotel does have a guests lounge on the 2nd floor with fireplace, comfortable furniture  big plasma TVs, newspapers, etc. NEGATIVES: They offer buffet breakfast in the 2nd floor lounge for $15 but in our opinion it wasn't worth the price. You can get free coffee AFTER 10:00am; I tried to get a cup before 10:00 and they wanted to charge me $15! There is a free wine  cheese gathering from 6:00-7:00 but that is such a narrow timeframe, we somehow managed to miss it every day. It ought to be expanded to at least 2 hrs. The lavatory in the bathroom is small  the sink awakwardly placed. These are pretty small negatives, I've already recommended this hotel to 2 friends and I look forward to staying there again. Maybe they'll have beefed up the breakfast buffet and extended the wine  cheese time by then. Great place to stay!  
<Date>Dec 23, 2005

<Author>family4travels
<Content>Great Stay at Affinia 50 We stayed at the Affinia 50 for 5 nights with our two kids the week before Thanksgiving. Most of the staff was fairly young but they were very nice and always EXTREMELY helpful.  We had a room with 2 queen beds. The room was really a very nice size with plenty of extra space and good closet and drawer space and a nice size tv. There was also a small kitchenette which we didn't really use, but liked the full size frig (I hate those tiny hotel refrigerators filled with so much stuff they want you to buy you can't even keep a bottle of water cold!). The only negative was that the bathroom was fairly small, especially for 4 people, but we managed. They had a nice Club Room on the 2nd floor, and it turned out the breakfast (not included) there wasn't bad, with hard boiled eggs, good bagels, croissants, great pineapple and strawberry skewers, lox and cold cereals. I think we ended up eating there 2x for breakfast. It was particularly handy when we needed an early start.It is in a good location. Was very quiet, we never had any trouble with noise from the street or any other room. Would definitely consider staying there again.  
<Date>Dec 1, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Terrific We arrived in NYC after dark and easily found the Affinia 50 hotel. We were greeted by the doorman, bags handled, and checked in all within 15 minutes of arrival. The room (a 1 bdrm suite) was very spacious, clean and featured several nice touches. A small kitchen was handy although I would gladly give up some kitchen space for more bathroom space. The bathroom is VERY small. The beds were quite comfortable and the hotel offers a pillow menu to augment the pillows already in the room. There is a club room on the 2nd floor which makes a nice sitting area in between NYC activities. The excercise facility is adequate. The location of the hotel was perfect for our activities. Lots of good places to eat nearby. Overall we would say the Affinia 50 has it right and will definitely stay again. The staff to a person was pleasant, helpful, and available when needed, but not generally visible (which is the way we like it). When comparing room rates for other hotels we felt like we received a very good value, although NYC is the capital of price shock.

<Author>sobo97
<Content>Great Location for the Marathon My fianc茅 and I were in NYC for the marathon and found the Affina 50 to be a great location. It was near the 51st and Lex subway station. 50th street is quiet and there was a great club downstairs. The beds were very comfortable and the hotel gave you a choice of pillows. The price was reasonable for downtown Manhattan. The staff was friendly and helpful.We stayed in a guest room, so there was just a refrigerator and a coffee pot. We had a room on the fifth floor that was quiet, but no view. Monday through Thursday on the 2nd floor, the hotel hosts a wine and cheese reception from 6-7 PM. The 2nd floor has two large rooms with comfortable couches and chairs to sit and talk.Internet wise, each room has a high speed connection and on the 2nd floor there are two computers where you can purchase time.Overall, we had a great stay at the Affina 50 and would recommend this hotel to our friends.  
<Date>Nov 10, 2005

<Author>Kathie615
<Content>Loved the Affinia 50 My friend and I stayed at the Affinia 50 in August for four nights during our annual trip to NYC. We usually stay in the Times Square area, but decided to try a new locale. The Affinia was wonderful. The doormen (Lenny and Andy) were very nice and helpful. The front desk staff were extremely pleasant. We had a two-bed room with a small kitchen. Bathroom was stocked with Aveda products. Nice! The beds were like heaven, so comfy. The hotel was very quiet. We could not hear the other guests at all. Location is quite a walk from Times Square. Subway nearby. Market around the corner was good for breakfast, kind of expensive though. The hotel next door has a breakfast buffet for $12. We didn't realize that until our last day. Would definitely try that as we spent that much at the market for just a muffin, fruit, and coffee. There is also a McDonald's around the corner for a quick meal. Hotel was very clean and comfortable. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Loved the Affinia 50!

<Author>mad4travel
<Content>Excellent hotel The Affinia 50 was a great stay. The staff were friendly and efficient, the rooms well decorated and spacious, the location a stones throw from lots of attractions and shopping.The extra nice touches were the small kitchens in each room, great for making coffee or snacks and the executive lounge on the 2nd floor where you can sprawl out on comfy sofas wtch the large screen plasma TV or check your E Mail (cost extra)If you are catering for yourself there is a great deli on third ave just one block from the hotel (turn left on third) or a large grocery store (associated) one block over of 48th and 2nd.My only critisism is the cost, however compared to the cost of comparable hotels in the area it is very good value for money.I would stay there again.

<Author>Wahoowa_ND
<Content>Affinia is the Best Affordable Hotel in NYC I am pleased to be writting my 5-star approval of the Affinia 50. At the height of the travel season in late August, my fiancee and I stayed at a suite (approx. 625 sq. ft.) for only $150 a night. Typically when I booked through Expedia the hotel would give you the last available rooms...not the best. However, I called a few days in advance and again the day of to find they accomodated us in a suite for no extra charge, additionally they gave us a requested view! With no hassle they took care of all my requests. Three other big advantages to the Affinia 50: Its excellent location a few blocks east of Time Square and the center of Midtown; the outstanding, helpful staff who arranged cars, flowers, etc; third, the 2nd floor breakfast cafe and lounge--great for getting an early bite before meetings. In conclusion this hotel, thanks to its staff, have made me a permanent customer on my trips to NYC. Thanks Affinia 50!

<Author>Jeannie13
<Content>Affinia50 is a great place to stay in NYC My husband and I stayed at the Affinia50 on E. 50th Street in NYC this past weekend at the recommendaion of a friend. The hotel is well located within walking distance of St. Patricks, NBC and Broadway. We were in Room 503. When we arrived (2 hours later than expected because of the torrential rain!), we were greeted with a very pleasant Welcome Home from the doorman. Once inside, we were offered punch and set up with our room immediately. The room itself was large (unusual in the City), clean and nicely appointed. Every time we contacted anyone in the hotel we were met with a can do attitude and a pleasant smile. This hotel has the same issue most older NYC hotels have -- the rooms do not have individual heating and air controls so your room can get very warm if the air is turned off in the hotel -- which was the case while we were there. I called to complain that my room was too warm and housekeeping sent me a fan within 5 minutes. I stay in NYC several times a year and I can tell you that I have never stayed at a hotel where I have received such nice and efficient treatment. I will stay there again. This hotel gets 5 stars from me and my recommendation as a premier place to stay.  
<Date>Oct 19, 2005

<Author>marywoodall
<Content>Terrific Stay! We stayed in a one bedroom suite for 5 nights and absolutely loved it. There was an unbelievable amount of room in the living/dining area and a fully-equipped separate kitchen. The staff was very friendly and helpful. During the week, we enjoyed complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings. The location is perfect and walkable to virtually every attraction in New York. And, if you don't care to walk, there is a subway with 3 lines just a block away. Around the corner is a terrific deli/quick stop that has an incredible selection of hot foods 24 hours a day. I will definitely stay at the Affinia 50 when I return to New York.

<Author>KateQuigley
<Content>'Welcome Home' We stayed at the Affinia 50 from the 26th-28th August. We had been in New York the previous week at The Bentley and had travelled to Las Vegas in between.The Affinia 50 was much nicer than the Bentley, but as another tripadvisor user had stated, we also booked a Studio Suite and expected a kitchen but we did not receive one. We didn't ask to move though as we were only there for 2 nights. The morning we arrived, we got there at about 8am due to an overnight flight from Vegas. Both me and my fiance were very tired and we had not booked an early check in. The hotel were very accomodating and put us in a room straight away for no extra charge. The room was quite spacious and had a classy boutique feel about it. The bed was extremely comfortable and there was a pillow menu you could choose from - although we didn't partake in this.We did not eat at the hotel so we cannot comment on the breakfasts. There is a little deli around the corner that sells everything! so if you fancy a late night snack or some breakfast, then pop in there.We did find a lovely mexican restaurant around the corner that did the best chilli I have ever tasted and frozen margeritas and mojitos for $3 - they were like rocket fuel!!!! Definately go there as it was great and cheap!The Affinia was a very nice hotel, the staff were helpful and friendly. Every time you came back through the doors the doorman said 'Welcome home'! Tacky, but nice all the same.I would recommend this hotel if you can get a cheap rate, otherwise it is pretty pricey.  
<Date>Sep 25, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Incredibly Spacious east side Hotel! Simply put, the Affina 50 is a very nice place. As a frequent traveler to NYC , I have stayed in the following hotels: Westin Times Square, Millennium Broadway, Holiday Inn 57th st., Hotel Pennsylvania (worst ever), and now the Affina 50. Location is great, besides being away from times square. Many other places around, including good food. Also, this is the biggest room I have had in the city. Excellent king bed, spacious bathroom. Our suite included a fully equipped kitchen as well. Our first night of our stay, we stopped at the grocery store around the corner and got some food items. We made cookies in the room that night, and made french toast and eggs the next morning. Very comfortable place that really feels like home. Our room did not have a view at all, facing a brick building, but we didn't mind because it was very quiet for being on the 6th floor. Excellent storage space in the room for everything you could bring. Also, very nice couch and chair with ottoman to relax.Pros: Priced Right, Great bed and bath, friendly staff, VERY SpaciousCons: $9.95/day for high speed internetWonderful Place, Highly Reccomended! Cheers!  
<Date>Sep 24, 2005

<Author>JAXMASSIE
<Content>Affinia 50 - fab We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on this website and it more than lived up to its reputation. We had requested a king suite, preferrably on a high floor and were not disappointed. Ended up in a room with two queen beds on the 14th floor so was much bigger than a king would have been. Although the kitchen was 'dated' (as someone mentioned recently) it was perfectly adequate - not that we made much use of it when we discovered an amazing deli round the corner. The hotel was in a fantastic location. Found a couple of good, cheap (for New York) bars nearby. Worth checking out the FUBAR - free popcorn! and the burgers at The Press Room were excellent. If you like mexican Mama Mexicos just along East 50th is fabulous.If you have time go to the Bronx Zoo - a nice relaxing change of pace for a day.Can't wait to go back and would defo stay in the Affinia again.

<Author>ants
<Content>Great hotel but be careful of what you book!! We stayed at Affinia 50 hotel for 5 days end August, early September. I'd booked directly with the hotel 5 months previously and requested a Studio Suite (having seen floor plans on the net decided that the studio was a good size with small kitchen so we could do our thing for breakfast) and also requested a quiet room on a high floor. When we arrived we were given a room on 4th floor overlooking 3rd Ave. Arriving in the room we found there was no kitchen, only a bar fridge and coffee maker, no table and chairs or sofa. We queried this and were told that we would have to pay US$30 extra per night to have kitchen facilities. Also they couldn't do anything about not being on a high floor.........we were told perhaps if we inquired the next morning someone may be able to help. The outside noise was incredible that night so enquired next morning and were shown a dark room on floor 19, wedged next to the lift. We opted to stay where we were and put up with the noise at night, after all we were in NY. The room itself was great, lovely soft bed and quite roomy with great bathroom. What annoyed me was the fact that I had booked so early and was told my requests had been noted and would be fulfilled. I even emailed when we were leaving for our holiday to confirm details and was assured that everything was in order. I really think we were just given a room, not a suite and were charged suite price. We had a great time in New York and would got back to that hotel again but I'm still disappointed with the treatment we got.  
<Date>Sep 14, 2005

<Author>immagini
<Content>Excellent Boutique Hotel!! Hotel was fantastic! Friendly people, awesome padded comfortable beds, better sleep than home. Pillow menu (pillows on the bed are wonderful) but you had a choice of non-allergenic, buckwheat, memory foam. Nice modern decor. THE BEST LOCATION!! We stayed in room 402, which was in the back of the hotel and very quiet. If you stay on the first 5 floors, you can use a side elevator and avoid lines that I read about in other posts. Hotel is on 50th and 3rd. Walking distance to U.N., Rockefeller Center, etc. W Hotel across the street with bar Whiskey Blue, which is Rande Gerber's place (Cindy Crawford's husband). Dress if you are going to stop in on a weekend, it was a fab sex-in-the-city crowd on a Saturday.I grew up in NYC, and Ess-a-Bagel is authentic bagel place that is at 830 3rd Ave (About 1 1/2 blocks away - cross the street at 3rd, walk left, it's on the block). They boil the bagels, then bake them. Man who owns the place was in there this morning (Sunday) - he cut me some belly lox - which is saltier than Nova lox - YUM! Tried the chopped herring and whitefish salad - the best - gotta love my city and the food!

<Author>NYCforMe
<Content>The Affinia 50 Feels Like Home! After weeks of internet research, and reading all the reviews on TripAdvisor, I decided to book the Affinia 50 for a vacation stay with 3 other female family members. What a great choice! We arrived just a little past noon, and the doorman saw us from the corner with our luggage and quickly came with a cart to greet us and help us get settled. (All of the staff members were helpful, friendly and polite.) Check-in was quick and easy, and even though it was just past noon, our one-bedroom suite on the 9th floor was ready. We were so surprised when we walked in and saw the size of the suite! The living room and dining area were quite large, and the kitchen, even though small, had a full-sized refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, dishes and a toaster. The beds were big and comfy, and the bathroom wasn't huge, but was bigger than most other NYC hotels I've stayed in. We really felt like we had our own little apartment in the city. Everything was very clean, and the abundance of Aveda products was a nice touch. There was even a fitness room and a nice lounge on the second floor that I wish we'd had more time to enjoy, but we were out exploring most of the time! The midtown east location was great - lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. Ess-a-Bagel was great for getting breakfast bagels, and a little shop called Azure had milk, fruit, cereals, soft drinks, etc. to take back to the room. The walk to the Times Square area only takes about 15 minutes, and there are subway lines close-by that get you anywhere you need to go. I would definitely recommend the Affinia 50, and I would stay there again without hesitation. When you walk into the lobby, the doorman always says, Welcome home, and that's just how we felt - at home!  
<Date>Sep 6, 2005

The room was modern and comfortable, the 2 queen beds were more comfortable than my bed at home (which is never the case). The bathroom although tiny was wonderfully decorated and clean.
